title: Account Executive Saas (Nordics)
description:
**At YesWeHack we’re on a mission - to make the world a safer place by stopping cyber attack breaches, leveraging our global Ethical Hackers' Network (70k+).** 




  





 Founded in 2015,
 **YesWeHack** 
 is
 **Europe #1 bug bounty platform** 
 , with offices in France (Paris, Rouen, Rennes) and Singapore. We provide a disruptive approach to Cyber Security through Bug Bounty programs, by connecting
 **Ethical Hackers** 
 worldwide with organizations to secure their exposed scopes the agile way.
 **We raised** 
**a total of £39M through 3 series of fund raising to fuel our growth ambitions.** 




  





 As a Scaleup, we are further expanding into the
 **Nordics Markets** 
 , and strengthening our teams with passionate sales consultants. We are currently recruiting for a
 **Fluent Swedish** 
**Account Executive (Nordic Markets)** 
 .
 



  





 You can access some of public Nordics clients programs through : https://yeswehack.com/programs
 



  





 Reporting to Sam, our European Sales Manager based in London, you will be in charge of developing a new clients portfolio, in line with our global growth strategy.
 



  





**Your main missions :** 



* Approach your client base with a consultative sales methodology
* Evangelize your prospects, generate new business through inbound and outbound opportunities, and close new customers in Europe through high level, value focused conversations
* Act as a trusted advisor to your customers and help them scaling bug bounty model internally to grow your relationships, in coordination with our customer success team
* Manage your own territory as if it were your own business
* Participate in events across the Nordics Region
* Ensure strong reporting, pipelining and forecasting



  





**Your Profile** 



* Proven consultative sales experience in high technology (ideally Saas)
* Ability to prospect and manage C-level and senior-level relationships within organizations of various sizes and industries
* Knowledge of the full life cycle of the sales process from prospecting to close
* Use sales as a teaching opportunity to create value and challenge the customer to think differently.
* Team player with the ability to work independently
* Teachable and embracing of best practices and feedback as a means of continuous improvement
* Fluency in Swedish or Finish is required

title: Producer
description:
**Who We Are**
 At
 **Kurppa Hosk Communications** 
 , we don’t just build brands—we create unforgettable stories that resonate in the modern age of communication. Whether it’s a thumb-stopping social post or a large-scale global campaign, our work captures the attention of our clients’ most coveted audiences. We’re the creative business partner that thrives at the intersection of logic and imagination, delivering what we call
 **Business Artistry** 
 . With over 80 of the sharpest minds in strategy, creativity, and production, we guide our clients from brand purpose through to concept development and execution, always with a commitment to excellence.
   

  

 Now, as we continue to grow, we’re looking for a talented
 **Producer** 
 who is eager to join our dynamic team and keep our productions on track, ensuring that every project is delivered on time, on budget, and to the highest standard.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 Imagine stepping into a role where you’re at the heart of the creative process, guiding projects from the spark of an idea all the way to their final execution. At Kurppa Hosk Communications, you’ll work closely with our Client and Account Directors, navigating the creative journey with a steady hand and a sharp eye for detail. You align with the creative team on the objectives, making sure everyone is clear on their tasks and deadlines.
   

  

 You’re the glue that holds the project together, balancing the need to encourage creative freedom with the necessity of delivering on client expectations. You’re not just managing timelines and budgets—you’re inspiring the team to push the boundaries of what’s possible while ensuring that every deliverable meets the high standards we set for ourselves. When challenges arise, you’re the one who steps in with solutions, keeping the project on track and the team motivated.
   

  

 Your knack for detail and your passion for problem-solving ensure that every project you touch not only meets the brief but exceeds expectations. And when the project is delivered on time, within budget, and with a quality that makes the entire team proud, you know you’ve done your job well.
   

  

**Your Impact**
 In this role, you’re more than just a producer — you’re the driving force behind some of our most innovative and impactful communications. Picture yourself overseeing the production of a campaign that’s destined to be a game-changer for one of our clients. You’re in charge of the entire production chain, from initial concept discussions through to final delivery, making sure that every detail is perfect and every deadline is met.
   

  

 Your expertise in budget management allows you to steer the team with confidence, ensuring that the creative vision is realized without compromising on resources. You’re the one who reminds the team of deadlines, not once, but as many times as needed to keep things moving forward. And when it comes to client interactions, your strong communication skills and ability to handle feedback with grace make you an invaluable partner in the creative process.
   

  

 As a Producer at Kurppa Hosk Communications, your role is to make sure that every project is not just completed, but completed brilliantly. You’re the person who brings order to the creative chaos, ensuring that the final product is something everyone can be proud of.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You’re the kind of person who thrives in a fast-paced, creative environment where every day brings new challenges and opportunities. With over five years of experience in production, you’ve managed a broad range of projects and know how to keep everything on track from start to finish. You love the details, and you have a passion for solving problems—even the tough ones that require out-of-the-box thinking.
   

  

 You have a client-focused mindset, understanding that our clients are the reason we do what we do. You enjoy the collaborative process of creating outstanding work together, and you’re not afraid to take charge when needed. Deadlines don’t scare you; in fact, you respect them and know how to keep the team on track to meet them—no matter how many reminders it takes.
   

  

 Your expertise in budget management is your guiding star, helping you drive the team forward without compromising on quality. You’re also a strong communicator, comfortable handling customer contact and feedback, and you’re fluent in English, both written and verbal.
   

  

 At Kurppa Hosk Communications, you’ll find a place where your skills are valued, your ideas are nurtured, and your contributions are recognized. This is more than just a job—it’s an opportunity to be a key player in creating communication that stands out and makes a real impact.
   

  

**What’s In It For You**
 When you join Kurppa Hosk Communications as a Producer, you’re stepping into a role that’s designed for growth and creativity. Imagine a career where you’re not just managing projects but driving the production of some of the most exciting and innovative campaigns in the industry. We offer a competitive salary that reflects your expertise and potential, as well as comprehensive benefits to keep you at your best, both in and out of the office.
   

  

 Our office is located in the heart of Stockholm, where you’ll work alongside some of the most talented professionals in the business. We believe in work-life balance, and we offer the flexibility to ensure that you thrive in both your personal and professional life. Here, your contributions are recognized, and your career is given the space to flourish.
   

  

 We are a creative agency blending strategy, design, and creativity to build unforgettable brands. Brought together under the vision and philosophy of Kurppa Hosk, we act as the dedicated communications arm.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Erfaren upphandlare
description:
**vid Ekonomiavdelningen. Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-09-30.**
 Vill du arbeta med utmanade och intressanta arbetsuppgifter i en spännande organisation? Stockholms universitet söker en erfaren upphandlare som vill bidra till att Stockholms universitets forskare får tillgång till rätt varor och tjänster för att bedriva framstående forskning.
   

  

 Stockholms universitet är ett av Europas ledande universitet i en av världens mest dynamiska huvudstäder. Universitetet är en av landets största myndigheter, med en årlig omsättning på drygt 6 miljarder kronor. Här är mer än 29 000 studenter, 1 300 doktorander och 5 600 medarbetare verksamma inom de naturvetenskapliga och humanvetenskapliga områdena. I organisationen finns ca 50 institutioner där universitetets kärnverksamhet, utbildning och forskning bedrivs samt den centrala universitetsförvaltningen med tolv avdelningar, däribland Ekonomiavdelningen.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 De dagliga arbetsuppgifterna kommer att vara mycket omväxlande och innefatta parallella upphandlingar av tjänster och entreprenader, samt upphandlingar avseende forskningsrelaterade varor och tjänster. Som upphandlare kommer du att agera projektledare och samarbeta med kravställarna tillika verksamhetsrepresentanter i upphandlingar. I arbetet ingår också att informera om avtal, ge råd och stöd till organisationen, samt utbildningar för medarbetare i verksamheten. Du deltar även i interna och externa nätverk.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 För anställningen förväntas du ha minst fyra års erfarenhet av att självständigt ha genomfört upphandlingar inom Lagen om offentlig upphandling (LOU) och vana att hantera flera projekt parallellt, samt ha erfarenhet av elektroniska upphandlingssystem och god kunskap i officepaketet. Du har mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift såväl på svenska som på engelska.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* erfarenhet av upphandling av komplexa tjänster
* erfarenhet av upphandling av IT produkter/tjänster
* erfarenhet av upphandling av entreprenader och fastighetsrelaterade varor och tjänster
* erfarenhet av av arbete i projektform/projektledning
* erfarenhet av av avtalsprocesser
* erfarenhet av AFF
* erfarenhet från upphandlingsverksamhet inom universitets- och högskolesektorn.


 Som person är du självgående och arbetar strukturerat och metodiskt. Nyfikenhet och en vilja att utvecklas ser vi som önskvärt. Vi tror att du har uppnått en personlig mognad och säkerhet i dig själv som gör att du har förmågan att hantera arbetstoppar på ett bra sätt då tempot tidvis är högt. Då många projekt genomförs i grupp är god samarbetsförmåga ett krav. Du tycker om att bygga relationer och har förmågan att skapa förtroende. Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

**Anställningsvillkor**
 Anställningen avser heltid och gäller tills vidare med sex månaders provanställning. Stockholms universitet tillämpar individuell lönesättning, ange därför gärna löneanspråk. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Stockholms universitet strävar efter att vara en arbetsplats som är fri från diskriminering och ger lika möjligheter för alla.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 Närmare information om anställningen lämnas av upphandlingschef Susanne Ekman, tfn 08-16 44 57, susanne.ekman@su.se.
   

  

**Fackliga företrädare**
 Ingrid Lander (Saco-S), tfn 0708-16 26 64, saco@saco.su.se, Alejandra Pizarro Carrasco (Fackförbundet ST/OFR), tfn 08-16 34 89, alejandra@st.su.se, samt seko@seko.su.se (SEKO).
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Du söker anställningen via Stockholms universitets rekryteringssystem. Du som sökande ansvarar för att ansökan är komplett i enlighet med annonsen och att den är universitetet tillhanda senast sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 Bifoga endast personligt brev och CV. Kopior på betyg och intyg tar du med vid en eventuell intervju.
   

  

 Anvisningar för sökande finns på webbsidan: att söka en anställning.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Stockholms universitet bidrar till det hållbara demokratiska samhällets utveckling genom kunskap, upplysning och sanningssökande.

title: Content Planner & Curator for Kids
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Content Planner & Curator for Kids** 
 in our
 **Stockholm office** 
 – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The role**
 Are you passionate about children's content and have strong organizational and communication skills? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! Viaplay is looking for a Content Planner & Curator to join our Stockholm office and manage our Kids Content Curation.
   

  

 In this role, you will be responsible for planning and curating content for the Kids section, ensuring that prioritized content is effectively scheduled and promoted. This includes managing metadata quality and overseeing content planning, scheduling, and coordination to maintain a dynamic and engaging Kids lineup throughout the year across Viaplay Nordics.
   

  

**Content Planning & Curation**
* Develop and implement content plans and title selections for the Kids section based on priorities and the editorial calendar.
* Request and customize promotional materials to support content planning activities.
* Ensure prioritized Kids content is featured prominently and meets performance expectations.
* Continuously monitor and evaluate the performance of Kids content blocks and titles.
* Utilize relevant technical tools for content planning and scheduling across multiple platforms.


**Metadata Management**
* Source and manage metadata for Kids content across Viaplay Group brands and platforms.
* Maintain high metadata quality and create localizations specific to the Kids section across the Nordics.
* Ensure accurate categorization and compliance with metadata guidelines for all Kids titles.
* Handle Danish translations for Kids content including synopses, copy, and messaging.
* Coordinate with system managers for metadata improvements in our tools (e.g., Movida).


**Content Scheduling & Coordination**
* Plan and schedule Kids content, ensuring alignment with the Editorial Kids Plan and content prioritization.
* Evaluate and analyze potential acquisitions, re-licenses, and new deals for Kids content, including ROI analysis.
* Serve as the internal point of contact for Kids content licenses, premiere dates, rights, and USPs at Viaplay Nordics.
* Collaborate with Content Operations and Media Coordinators to ensure timely delivery and publication of Kids content, creating Jira tickets as necessary.
* Update scheduling systems and communicate any changes internally.
* Monitor content performance and enhance content discovery for Kids programming.


**External Activities**
* Engage with potential partners for external activities such as events and competitions related to Kids content.
* Coordinate and support participants in these events, ensuring successful execution.


**What We’re Looking For**
 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

* A few years of experience in project management, content planning, or a similar role.
* Strong communication skills with the ability to engage with colleagues, stakeholders, and customers.
* Driven, engaged, and a team player who can work independently and confidently.
* An understanding of research and analysis with a creative approach to content planning.
* Basic skills in Photoshop, and familiar with systems like Airtable and Jira.
* Education in business, marketing, content management, or a related field.
* Ability to present ideas and plans convincingly and inspiringly.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Strong stakeholder management skills with an understanding of business impact.
* Experience in media, entertainment, or content management, particularly for children’s programming, is a plus.


**What We Offer You**
**We’ve got you covered!** 
 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
   

  

**Your wellbeing matters.** 
 We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
   

  

**A safe space to grow and up-skill.** 
 Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
   

  

**Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do** 
 . So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including series & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.
   

  

**Hit play** 
 today
   

  

 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Solution Advisor Specialist, Sweden, Signavio
description:
**We help the world run better**
 At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 To thrive in this role you are someone who appreciates close collaboration, open communication, and feedback.
   

  

**You Will Be Expected To**
* Strategize, prepare and deliver engaging solution demonstrations, presentations and business cases to prospects and clients that lead to successful sales outcomes with Signavio’s products and services.
* Lead technical process mining evaluations (Proof of Concepts) requiring large-scale data manipulation scenarios.
* Respond to Request for Proposals (RFPs) (functional, technical, security aspects) and deliver timely, detailed, and well-crafted follow-up reports and presentations to client and prospect requests for additional information.
* Develop and maintain expert knowledge of Signavio’s solution suite, competitive product offerings, market intelligence, and unique differentiation.
* Collaborate with Sales enablement and product teams to share market insight and solutions, and work with post-sales delivery teams to ensure long term customer success.
* Provide thought leadership, technical expertise and best practice knowledge around process mining and process management to our prospects and customers.


**What You Bring**
* Presales and Enterprise Solution Consulting experience, ideally within the field of Business Process Management
* Deep understanding of key business processes, such as Order-to-Cash, Procure-to-Pay, Make-to-Order, etc.
* A self-starter, you show initiative and enjoy being part of a great team in an international organization.
* Strong presentation and communication skills.
* Familiarity with major ERP systems, data extraction, data analysis, reporting is an advantage.
* Familiarity with process mining and process mining applications.
* Strong analytical skills including value analysis, business case development, ROI calculations, etc.
* Ability to juggle multiple projects among multiple stakeholders (internal and external) simultaneously.
* Willingness to travel e.g. 30%.
* Bachelor’s Degree (or higher) in Computer Science, Business Information Technologies or equivalent experience.


**Meet your team**
 In this role you will be working in a cross-functional team who values trust, respect and diversity. We are looking for people who share our passion for creating products that people love to use.
   

  

**Bring out your best**
 SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
   

  

**We win with inclusion**
 SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
   

  

 SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com
   

  

 For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.
   

  

**EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability**
 Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.
   

  

 Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
   

  

 Requisition ID: 404125 | Work Area: Presales | Expected Travel: 0 - 30% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: .

title: Business Segment Manager - Core Lab
description:
Roche fosters diversity, equity and inclusion, representing the communities we serve. When dealing with healthcare on a global scale, diversity is an essential ingredient to success. We believe that inclusion is key to understanding people’s varied healthcare needs. Together, we embrace individuality and share a passion for exceptional care. Join Roche, where every voice matters.
   

  

 The Position
   

  

 Do you have knowledge and experience working with sales and marketing within Swedish healthcare, Clinical chemistry? Do you have the ambition to influence, to work cross functionally and collaboratively and would like to drive the commercial strategy to develop win-win opportunities, then this position could be of interest for you!
   

  

**Business Segment Manager- Core Lab**
 We are now looking for a
 **Business Segment Manager** 
 to join our dedicated Commercial Excellence team focused on
 **Clinical Chemistry** 
 . As a Business Segment Manager at Roche Diagnostics, you have the ability to influence your own development and you get the opportunity to be the orchestrator of customer development opportunities that improves and optimizes healthcare resources and that delivers and implements the best possible solutions within Clinical Chemistry.
   

  

 The Business Segment Manager’s main purpose is to create better health outcomes by delivering:
   

  

* Clear support from stakeholders for early implementation of high health impact launches into clinical routine
* More co-designed and tested win-win opportunities through commercial excellence


**Key Job Responsibilities:**
**Customer and market needs and insights:**
* Responsible for the summary of data insights about our market and competitors
* Turn insights into clear, co-created, Business Segment strategies


**Ensuring implementation of Roche Solutions:**
* Co-create go-to-market strategies based on experiments and interactions with relevant external stakeholders
* Overall responsible for localization of the value proposition, including key messages to be used in the market


**Commercial Excellence and value capturing**
* Own and lead, selected, sales opportunities
* Responsible for the Business Segment Strategy - Core lab solutions
* Responsible for the commercial strategy in RFI/tender initiatives to support optimal value capturing
* Proactively support and coach the Commercial Specialists to identify, drive and win opportunities


**Your contribution**
 Your focus is to get insights and understand the needs of our market and customers within Clinical Chemistry. To ensure implementation of Roche solutions. To capture the value, bring commercial excellence. You have a growth mindset and willingness to develop a strategic approach to stakeholder management. You are furthermore comfortable interacting with senior levels within healthcare departments and you have an in-depth understanding of Roche offering within Core Lab in focus. You are skilled at project management, and you can identify the right expertise needed to drive an opportunity forward. Have the ability to navigate and work within a changing organization, maintaining objectivity, respect for differences of opinion, fairness, and open communication and feedback. You are very independent in your work and like to take initiative. It is also important that you are a team player that likes to contribute to the group and collaborate towards common goals.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Minimum 7 years of sales and/or marketing experience within Swedish Healthcare
* University degree in relevant field
* Proficient in Swedish and English
* Strong understanding of clinical laboratory medicine customers/medtech and decision making processes
* Strong understanding and knowledge of the Swedish healthcare system and regional and national decision making
* Experience in managing relationships with KOLs
* Overarching knowledge of Roche offering across all customer / disease areas and deep understanding within the designated area for this position
* Strong financial acumen
* Project management and informal leadership
* Experience with common Sales methodology (Miller Heiman, Gold Sheet)
* No restriction for traveling
* Located in Sweden, Stockholm area


 Who we are
   

  

 At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.
   

  

**Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.**

title: HPE Financial Services Partner Sales Manager
description:
This role has been designed as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2-3 days per week from an HPE office.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.
   

  

**Job Description**
**A day in the life of HPE Financial Services Partner Sales Manager:**
 Role measured on HPEFS Leasing Volume and margin contribution within identified strategic resellers, partner satisfaction and effective management of partner relationship.
   

  

* Act as HPEFS point of contact with Channel partner for all Financing queries - particularly with partner's key Sales, Marketing and Product management, same with the HPE and HP Partner Business channel team.
* Develop and implement program strategy which includes integration into HPE / HP and HPEFS sales segment with special attention to driving HPEFS business to the Mid-market and SMB customers. Documented in Joint Business Planning designed and agreed with both Partner Executives and related HPE/HP related owner
* Own the HPEFS pipeline / lead generation with assigned Partners
* Accountability to have HPEFS Sales resources executing in timely manner on Partner pipeline.
* Involved in Deal processing and forecasting activities jointly with The Partner Sales teams, and HPE/HP related sales resources
* Overall responsibility for day-to-day operations of the HPEFS channel reward programme, ensuring partner satisfaction across all elements of the business transaction lifecycle: Sales, Credit, Documentation/Funding, Partner Incentive.
* Develop and provide training to partner sales teams.
* Drive quarterly onsite review meetings to review previous quarter results and to determine next steps for success.
* Drive regular communication to partner regarding Promotion updates, Tool updates, new Program announcements, etc.
* Identify, propose and implement additional capabilities within the Channel Partner business model to create increased value add for the reseller in the selling and promoting of HPEFS services.
* Gather and Provide competitive intelligence to both Partners and HPEFS


**You are...**
* Experienced in creating and managing relationship with IT Partner community - 3 to 5 years’ experience in IT sales, preferably in IT financing.
* Experienced at building Business Development strategy with IT Partners
* Successful sales experience including multiple, diverse set of selling responsibilities (own and individual sales quota carrying)
* Viewed as trusted expert in given field by customer; is a mentor of selling strategy, including designing strategy
* University or Bachelor's degree preferred
* Fluent in English and Swedish


**Additional Skills**
 Accountability, Accountability, Active Learning (Inactive), Active Listening, Assertiveness, Bias, Building Rapport, Buyer Personas, Coaching, Complex Sales, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cross-Functional Teamwork, Customer Experience Strategy, Customer Interactions, Design Thinking, Empathy, Financial Acumen, Follow-Through, Growth Mindset, Identifying Sales Opportunities, Industry Knowledge, Intellectual Curiosity (Inactive), Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity {+ 6 more}
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**
**Health & Wellbeing**
 We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.
   

  

**Personal & Professional Development**
 We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.
   

  

**Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging**
 We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.
   

  

**Let's Stay Connected**
 Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.
   

  

 #spain, #sweden
   

  

 #financialservices
   

  

**Job**
 Sales
   

  

**Job Level**
 Specialist
   

  

 HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to diversity and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We do not discriminate and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global diverse team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together. Please click here: Equal Employment Opportunity.
   

  

**Hewlett Packard Enterprise is EEO F/M/Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities.**
 HPE will comply with all applicable laws related to employer use of arrest and conviction records, including laws requiring employers to consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.

title: Senior avtalsansvarig till trafikkontoret, Stockholm stad
description:
Stockholm – vår huvudstad med miljoner drömmar, förväntningar och ambitioner. Vi jobbar för alla som lever här idag och i framtiden. Nu söker vi dig som vill tänka stort, nytt och annorlunda med oss – för stockholmarna.
   

  

 Trafikkontoret ansvarar för att sköta om och utveckla Stockholms offentliga rum, så att de är trygga, attraktiva, framkomliga och hållbara. Uppdraget innefattar allt ifrån att ta hand om den befintliga stadsmiljön till att genomföra strategiska investeringsprojekt och planera för morgondagens växande storstad. För att klara vårt uppdrag är vi ca 450 kollegor, som huvudsakligen sitter i Tekniska Nämndhusets nyrenoverade lokaler på Kungsholmen. Tillsammans ser vi till att Stockholm fortsätter vara en stad i framkant med hållbara transportlösningar och levande miljöer, både idag och i framtiden.
   

  

**Välkommen till oss**
 Har du erfarenhet av att jobba med avtal? Vill du ta dig an vårt nya driftavtal? Vi söker dig som vill bidra till samhällsnytta och kvalitet. I denna roll har du en viktig uppgift att självständigt ansvara för Stockholm stads driftavtal av offentliga toaletter. Välkommen att vara med från start med vårt nya avtal!
   

  

 Enheten tillsyn och drift ingår i stadsmiljöavdelningen. Vi ansvarar bland annat för inspektion av tillstånd på offentlig plats och kontroll av gatudriften. Vi ansvarar också för stadsövergripande driftavtal för t.ex. klottersanering och skadedjursbekämpning samt för stadens cykeljour. Vi utför ett viktigt arbete med direkt koppling till medborgarnas vardag.
   

  

 Enheten består av 21 medarbetare i rollerna inspektörer, avtalsansvariga, cykelvärdar, verksamhetssamordnare, avtalssamordnare och enhetschef. Vi söker nu en avtalsansvarig för vårt nya driftavtal för offentliga toaletter.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Vi värderar kvalitet, engagemang och samarbete högt. Vi erbjuder dig en trygg arbetsplats där vi hjälper och stöttar varandra i det vardagliga arbetet och värnar om den goda arbetsmiljön. Du ges möjlighet till personlig utveckling/kompetenspåfyllnad samt till delaktighet och inflytande på arbetsplatsen. Vi har flexibla arbetstider samt möjlighet till växling av semesterdagstillägg mot extra ledighet. Beroende på arbetsuppgifter och verksamhetsbehov finns möjlighet att varva kontorsarbete med att arbeta hemifrån två dagar i veckan. Arbetsmiljö och hälsa är viktigt för oss. Vi erbjuder friskvårdsersättning, friskvårdstimme och möjlighet att delta i friskvårdsaktiviteter. Läs mer om våra förmåner här
   

  

**Din roll**
 Du kommer ansvara för:
   

  

* Kontakt med leverantör.
* Kontakt med medborgare.
* Proaktiv och kontinuerlig uppföljning av avtalet.
* Avtalsutveckling.
* Tilldelning av vite vid brister i utförande.
* Budget- och prognosarbete.


 Idag arbetar det sju avtalsansvariga på enheten. Alla avtalsansvarig har ett eget driftavtal men ni delar kunskap och stöttar varandra i olika frågor. De driftavtal som finns på enheten idag är inom klottersanering, viltvård och skadedjursbekämpning, vägmarkeringar, vägmärken, räcken, portaler, gatujour och stadens flaggning.
   

  

**Hej från din blivande chef**
 Tove Nilsson heter jag och är din blivande chef. Jag har ett stort förtroende för mina medarbetare och deras förmåga. Min förhoppning är att vi kan hitta ett samarbete som bidrar till en positiv utveckling av enhetens medarbetare och verksamhet. Utöver det är det viktigt för mig att bygga relationer både internt och externt.
   

  

**Din kompetens och erfarenhet**
 Vi söker dig som har
   

  

* relevant högskoleutbildning
* flerårig och aktuell erfarenhet av självständigt arbete som avtalsansvarig
* är van att använda IT-baserade verktyg för exempelvis avtal
* har goda kunskaper i Office-paketet
* B-körkort
* har goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift.


 Det är meriterande om du har
   

  

* kunskap om entreprenadjuridik
* arbetat i en politisk styrd organisation
* kunskap om lokalvård.


 Vi söker dig som är van att ta ansvar för ditt arbete och självständigt strukturera och driva ditt arbete framåt. Du agerar professionellt utifrån ditt yrke och din roll. Du har även väl grundade och tydliga värderingar som avspeglas i uttryck och handlingar. Som person är du trygg, stabil och har självinsikt. Vidare planerar och organiserar du ditt arbete på ett effektivt sätt, prioriterar och håller uppsatta tidsramar. Du kommunicerar på ett tydligt sätt, säkerställer och följer upp att budskap når fram och att förväntningarna är klara för alla berörda. Då tjänsten innebär många kontaktytor är det viktigt att du är en lyhörd person som både uppskattar och har förmåga att samarbeta med andra människor.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper, motivation och engagemang för tjänsten.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Vi rekryterar utan det personliga brevet, i denna rekrytering, för att stärka fokus på de kompetenser och erfarenheter som efterfrågas för denna roll. Vid bedömningen av din ansökan kommer vi endast att utgå ifrån ditt CV och ett antal frågor du får besvara i samband med att du söker tjänsten. Vi önskar att du svarar konkret och kortfattat på frågorna, och att det finns en tydlig koppling mellan dina svar och ditt CV.
   

  

 Denna rekryteringsprocess kommer innehålla arbetspsykologiska tester.
   

  

 Vi ser mångfald som berikande och välkomnar alla sökande.
   

  

 Stockholms stad arbetar med kompetensbaserad rekrytering som syftar till att se till varje persons kompetens och därmed motverka diskriminering.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: Heltid | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/4684 | Kontakt: Linda Gustavsson, rekryteringskonsult 08-50811740, Tove Nilsson, enhetschef 08-50826281, | Facklig företrädare: Luis Lopez, Vision 08-50827929, Tomas Nitzelius, SACO 08-50826042, | Publicerat: 2024-09-23 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-10-07

title: Supply Chain & Operations Manager with focus on Fulfillment
description:
**Do you want to help solve complex Supply Chain problems to position our clients for sustainable growth while remaining resilient in times of change?**
 We are experiencing heavy growth and are searching for an excellent business-driven
 **Manager** 
 with
 **expertise within fulfillment** 
 . You will be part of a leading Nordic Supply Chain and Operations team, working on creating customer centric, resilient, and sustainable supply chains for clients across the Nordics. If you want to help solve complex problems, manage key stakeholders, and help design the supply chains of the future, we want to hear from you!
   

  

**What´s in it for you:**
- Competitive salary terms, bonus schemes, pension, health insurance, employee stock purchase program etc.

- Flexible workload – you have control over your everyday life

- Possibility to specialize and build expertise within supply chain topics through our trainings and specialization program

- Work in a team dedicated to complex problem solving within supply chain and operations, working in a range of industries and projects

- Work alongside leading Nordic and global subject matter experts

**What you will do:**
- Engage in transformation work ranging from operations optimization to technology-driven business transformation – providing the functional fulfillment expertise

- Address the needs of Supply Chain Officers and help them make strategic and operational Supply Chain decisions through value driven recommendations

- Provide expertise and insights to our clients to help them build the strategic roadmap for their transformation agendas

- Design and improve fulfillment processes and organizations to position the Supply Chain as a growth enabler

- Contribute to develop our Supply Chain and Operations practice’s assets and knowledge repository

- Mentor junior members of the Strategy & Consulting team and coach them for more responsibility and impact

**To succeed in this role, we believe you have:**
- 5–10 years of working experience from Supply Chain Management with focus on Fulfillment, preferably as Management Consultant or from an internal consulting role

- Experience from working with large Consumer Goods and / or Retail companies

- Excellent understanding of fulfillment processes, e.g. processes related to processing of orders, warehousing, packaging and shipping – both from a system and operational perspective

- Experience working with TMS, Last Mile, Automation, Network design is seen as beneficial

- Able to identify and pursue new business opportunities by teaming up with relevant colleagues, and lead and contribute to proposal work to build a pipeline of relevant client work for the SC&O practice – with focus on fulfillment

- Can communicate effectively and can put ideas and findings into the right context and to the right audience, both written and verbally

- Master Microsoft Office technology for analysis and presentations

- A Master’s degree in a relevant field, e.g. Logistics, Engineering or Business

- You can travel when required, depending on client and project context

**The position will report to the Supply Chain & Operations Lead in the Nordics. Preferred office location in Stockholm, Gothenburg, Malmö or Oslo**
**Interested?**
**Apply as soon as possible** 
 by attaching your
 **CV, cover letter and your educational documents including grades** 
 .
 **Thank you for your interest in joining Accenture. Due to the summer holiday season, our response time might be a bit longer than usual. Please note that we will review your application in August and get back to you shortly after.**
 If you have any questions concerning the role or the recruiting process, please contact Magnus Wigernäs +46 76 767 2134, Senior Recruiting Specialist Strategy & Consulting Nordics
   

  

**About Supply Chain And Operations**
 Accenture’s Supply Chain & Operations team is a world leading practice with a local presence in the Nordics. We are a part of Accenture Strategy & Consulting and focus on key topics for CEOs, COOs, Supply Chain and Procurement Chief Officers.
   

  

 We help our clients imagine and transform tomorrow’s supply chains and operations to positively impact business, society, and the planet. Our work includes optimizing and establishing flexible operations that enable rapid response to changing customer demands and market opportunities. Strategy, technology, analytics and solid execution are at the core of our efforts to future-proof Supply Chains that deliver on the promise of a better and more sustainable world.
   

  

**About Accenture**
**Accenture** 
 is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. With more than 740,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives.

title: Senior Legal Counsel - Regulatory
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the Legal team** 





 The Legal team at Trustly is the guardian of Trustly’s regulatory licenses in Sweden, France and the UK, consisting of experts in regulations on payment services, privacy & data protection and commercial law. Currently a team of ten and growing, based in Stockholm, Paris and London.
 








**About the role** 





 As a Senior Legal Counsel - Regulatory, you are part of a dynamic legal team providing expertise to the product & tech and commercial teams in all things involving payment services regulation and commercial contracts. You are a professional in legal risk assessment, keeping presence of mind in complex and urgent situations, and giving knowledgeable recommendations to decision-makers across the whole organization. The position is based in Stockholm.
 





  




**What you’ll do** 
* Safeguard the regulatory licenses of Trustly, including manage the relationships with the regulators with care and diligence
* Interpret payment services regulation, including translating this into meaningful and useful information for the product & tech team when it is designing innovative and human-centric payment products
* At times, support the commercial team in drafting and negotiating commercial contracts
* Support the organization in solution-oriented handling of various legal issues



  




**Who you are** 
* Holds a Master of Laws Degree
* 4-6 years of relevant experience from a payment services company, a commercial law firm, and/or supervisory authority is preferred (knowledge in PSD2 and future regulations on payment initiation services is a plus)
* Passionate about the payment industry
* Excellent English and Swedish language skills
* Driven and curious with a positive can-do attitude
* Terrific team player






  




  



 Kindly submit your CV in English.
 









 Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.
 









 If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, please apply now.

title: Account Executive - Nordics
description:
The
 **Account Executive** 
 is responsible for obtaining new business and customer expansion sales opportunities from Executive-level buyers and influencers in either private or publicly traded companies. Account Executives are focused on selling Workiva’s core platform and collaborate with other Workiva Solution Sales teams to deliver multi-solution sales.
   

  

 Successful candidates will build relationships and identify Workiva products and solutions that meet customer needs to drive customer acquisition within an assigned territory. Sales growth is attained through new customer subscriptions, professional services, delivery and training.
   

  

 This role is focused on enterprise customer accounts in the Nordics market.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Actively seek out sales opportunities in collaboration with peer Sales teams, Inside Sales, and Partnerships to generate qualified sales pipeline
* Utilize information gathered during the needs analysis phase to deliver a compelling demonstration of the Workiva platform
* Skillfully address customer objections - removing obstacles - and finding solutions to various client challenges
* Lead the sales process naturally - guiding it to a close by effectively showcasing Workiva's value proposition
* Regularly and promptly update customer relationship management tools to report customer contacts
* Provide consistent and accurate forward-looking information through pipeline analysis to forecast sales
* Develop and execute a sales strategy with purposeful action to secure the sale
* Rally internal support to pursue an account and optimize internal resources
* Prioritize selling activities and ensure timely follow-through
* Maintain a strong understanding of Workiva products through a commitment to ongoing training and a growth mindset


**What You'll Need**
 Minimum Qualifications
   

  

* 4+ years experience in a related role - enterprise technology or similar complex solution sales
* Undergraduate Degree or equivalent combination of knowledge and related career experience


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Understanding of the Software as a Service (SaaS) business model
* Ability to demonstrate complex software applications
* Strong business acumen and an ability to understand complex business challenges
* Executive presence and an ability to communicate at the most senior level
* Ability to identify and understand the power of influencers versus buyers and how to navigate the nuances of each during the sales cycle
* Ability to manage multiple complex sales cycles simultaneously
* Ability to negotiate pricing with a focus on retaining value
* Capability for achieving (and exceeding) sales quota targets
* Fluency in English required - additional fluency in Danish, Finnish, Norwegian or Swedish a plus


**Travel Requirement & Working Conditions**
* Up to 30% travel for regular customer meetings and events
* Reliable internet access required for any period of time working remotely and not in a Workiva office


 Workiva is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that great minds think differently. We value diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and interests, and we recognize diversity as an important source of intellectual thought, varied perspective, and innovation. Employment decisions are made without regard to age, gender identity, race, religion, disability status, sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic.
   

  

 Workiva is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. To request assistance with the application process, please email talentacquisition@workiva.com.
   

  

 Workiva employees are required to undergo comprehensive security and privacy training tailored to their roles, ensuring adherence to company policies and regulatory standards.

title: Finance Manager
description:
We are in an exciting phase of growth and are ready to elevate our company to the next level by strengthening our financial strategies and operations. We're looking for a dynamic and visionary Finance Manager who is passionate about driving financial excellence, has a deep understanding of financial management in a fast-paced environment, and knows how to lead the financial aspects of strategic initiatives and do not want to miss out on being part of this journey!
 



  





**What we offer** 



* The possibility to work with one of the fastest-growing and most successful marketing methods globally.
* A role in a passionate and high-performing team, with a strong company culture where we know the importance of helping each other and having fun together!
* The opportunity for you to make and impact and to work with strong brands and leading tech solutions for influencer marketing, covering collaborations with influencers around the world and campaigns that reach millions of followers.
* The opportunity to become a partner through stock option program
* Annual conference trips (we’ve been to places like Marbella, Barcelona, and London).



  





**About the role** 




 The role as Finance Manager at Cure Media is an extraordinary opportunity for the right
 



 candidate to join the top management team of a fast-growing, entrepreneur-led and private equity backed company. As Finance Manager you will be responsible for establish routines and format for both internal management reporting and external reporting to board of directors, owners and lenders. Furthermore, you will have the primary day-to-day responsibility for planning, managing and controlling all finance-related activities of the company and supporting the CEO on administrative responsibilities like for example invoicing, legal agreements etc. 
 



  





**Your tasks & Responsibilities** 




 The successful candidate will be analytical, structured and collaborative, serving as an important sparring partner to the CEO and board of directors, while also being a strong support to the parts of the business (e.g., operations, tech). As an entrepreneurial led company, we are looking for someone to be responsible for the following:
 


* Monthly reporting to Board of Directors
* Margin reporting and other management reporting as required
* Quarterly invoicing and follow ups
* Payroll management and employee agreements
* Client and supplier agreements
* Documentation in tender processes
* P&L and liquidity forecasting
* Calculation and analyses of new services, new markets and staffing
* ESG reporting
* Corporate policies



  





**Are you the one we’re looking for?** 




 At Cure Media, we pride ourselves on a strong culture built on our three core values: Brave, Passionate, and Results-focused. We are looking for a self-driven, analytical team player who takes ownership and responsibility, ready to join our management team.
 



  





**Requirements for the role** 



* Strong accounting knowledge and have experience from previous jobs
* Degree in business and/or finance
* Skilled in MS Office and other relevant systems for the role
* Fluent communication both in Swedish and English, as these are the languages you will use on a daily basis.
* If you have previous experience working at a scale-up company, it is considered an advantage but not a requirement.



  





 In return we offer an extraordinary work environment and to take part in our growth
 



 journey where we change the way brands interact with consumers. We offer competitive terms and also ownership in the company for the right candidate.
 



  





 If you want to continue developing in a central role within our team as a key player in shaping our company's future - apply for the Finance Manager position today!
 



  





**Start:** 
 ASAP
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm
 



**Hours:** 
 Full-time
 



  





 If you have any questions about the role, career development opportunities, or anything else? Get in touch!
 



  





*Cure Media is the leading influencer marketing agency in the Nordics, awarded as the Influencer Marketing Agency of the Year and ranked as the 3rd best tech platform globally.* 




  





*With our superior go-to-market model, data-driven approach and strong influencer expertise, we enable brands to effectively target and engage with consumers on the platforms where they spend their time. A performance-focused, commercial culture with passionate employees combined with a proprietary tech platform enables us to deliver superior value for our clients which includes leading brands like L’oreal, KappAhl and Sephora.* 




  





*Cure Media was founded in 2014 by Sam Foroozesh (CEO), Babak Faramarzian (Head of Product) and Kristian Melå (Head of Sales), and partnered with Equip Capital in November 2021.*

title: Underrättelsesamordnare till underrättelseenheten i Stockholm, med placering i regionala driftcentret (RDC)
description:
Är du redo för en större uppgift? Underrättelseenheten söker nu medarbetare som vill vara med och utveckla underrättelseenhetens arbete i främst det taktiska tidsperspektivet och vara vår representant i den regionala operativa verksamheten.
   

  

 Arbetsplatsbeskrivning
   

  

 Polismyndigheten är Sveriges största myndighet med ca 40 000 medarbetare över hela landet. Hos oss får du möjlighet att bidra till Polisens uppdrag – att öka tryggheten och minska brottsligheten i samhället.
   

  

 Polisregion Stockholm består av Stockholms län och Gotland. Verksamheten i regionen är organiserad i fyra polisområden: Nord, City, Syd och Gotland som tillsammans är indelade i 19 lokalpolisområden. Vidare finns det fyra regionala enheter: gränspolisen, operativa enheten, underrättelseenheten och utredningsenheten, ett regionkansli samt nationella avdelningar som finns representerade i regionen för att ge stöd till polisverksamheten.
   

  

 Underrättelseenheten i region Stockholm ansvarar för underrättelseverksamheten i regionen. Vid enheten bedrivs operativ och strategisk underrättelseverksamhet i syfte att förebygga, förhindra och upptäcka brottslig verksamhet. Uppdraget innefattar i huvudsak att inhämta, bearbeta, analysera samt delge information som ska utgöra underlag för beslut om operativa åtgärder.
   

  

 Underrättelseenheten söker nu medarbetare som vill vara med och utveckla underrättelseenhetens arbete i främst det taktiska tidsperspektivet och vara vår representant i den regionala operativa verksamheten. I rollen kommer du samordna och understödja myndigheten med underrättelseinformation i det taktiska tidsperspektivet i regionens driftcenter under dygnets alla timmar. Uppdraget är relativt nytt och befinner sig i en expansiv fas och du kommer ha möjlighet att bidra till utvecklingen.
   

  

 Underrättelsesamordnarna kommer att arbeta i driftcenter med placering på Kungsholmen.
   

  

 Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 Som underrättelsesamordnare arbetar du vid regionledningscentralen och bistår med stöd i beslutsfunktioner samt omhändertar och bearbetar information under dygnets alla timmar. Detta ställer höga krav på förmåga till självständigt arbete då du snabbt kan behöva analysera information, göra bedömningar och ta fram beslutsunderlag. Du är en del i ett team och kan behöva ha tät samverkan med alla delar och verksamheter inom Polismyndigheten.
   

  

 I rollen som underrättelsesamordnare inkluderas du i att:
   

  

* Vara underrättelseenhetens samordnare mot regionens händelsestyrda ledningsförmåga.
* Lägesfölja polisens händelsestyrda arbete och utgöra ett stöd för beslutsfunktioner.


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Detta är en möjlighet för dig som har:
   

  

* Avslutad gymnasieexamen eller utbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer som motsvarande.
* Erfarenhet av arbete som arbetsgivaren bedömer som relevant inom polisens kärnverksamhet eller hos annan arbetsgivare som bedriver brottsbekämpande verksamhet eller underrättelsearbete.
* Erfarenhet och god kunskap att arbeta parallellt i olika typer av datasystem.
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska.
* Möjlighet att arbeta skift under dygnets alla timmar, vilket inkluderar helger.
* Svenskt medborgarskap


 Det är meriterande om du även har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med underrättelsearbete eller genom arbete har kunskap om underrättelseprocessens beståndsdelar.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta riktat mot grov och organiserad brottslighet.
* Erfarenhet och god kännedom om polisens organisation.
* Erfarenhet av polisens interna IT-system.
* Erfarenhet av samverkan med interna och externa kontakter.
* Erfarenhet av att hålla presentationer eller föredrag för interna eller externa målgrupper.


 Personliga egenskaper
   

  

 För att bli aktuell och passa i rollen som underrättelsesamordnare behöver du ha ett högt säkerhetstänk och hög integritet, samt ha en förmåga att fatta beslut i ett stundtals högt tempo. Du har en förmåga att se samband och kan lägga ihop detaljer till en helhet och har således en analytisk förmåga. Du tar ansvar för din uppgift på ett självgående, strukturerat och initiativtagande sätt.
   

  

 I rollen som underrättelsesamordnare har du kontakt med interna som externa parter, med god samarbetsförmåga. Du är prestigelös och tydlig i din kommunikation. Att arbeta i en händelsestyrd verksamhet kräver ett flexibelt och serviceinriktat arbetssätt. Du kan skifta tillvägagångssätt när verksamheten kräver det och du har en tendens att se möjligheter i förändringar. För att vara lämpad i rollen behöver du även ha en stor personlig mognad.
   

  

 Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och din personliga lämplighet.
   

  

 Kontaktpersoner
   

  

 Har du frågor om uppdraget är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef:
   

  

 Frida Medin, frida.medin@polisen.se
   

  

 Har du frågor gällande rekryteringsprocessen kontakta ansvarig HR-konsult:
   

  

 Hanna Lundbäck, hanna.lundback@polisen.se
   

  

 Fackliga företrädare
   

  

 Polisförbundet, SACO-S, ST och SEKO nås via Polisens växel 114 14
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning, med sex månaders provanställning
   

  

 Arbetsort: Kungsholmen
   

  

 Arbetstid: Periodplanerad arbetstid 5:3 (skift)
   

  

 Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Funktion: Underrättelsesamordnare
   

  

 Från och med maj 2024 använder vi inte personligt brev i våra rekryterings-processer. Vi ber dig istället att bifoga ditt CV där du tydligt beskriver på vilket sätt du uppfyller efterfrågade kvalifikationer och meriter kopplat till aktuell rekrytering. Du kan se den kompletta kravprofilen i jobbannonsen.
   

  

 Utöver CV behöver du även besvara ett antal urvalsfrågor som en del av din ansökan. Dessa frågor utgår från aktuell kravprofil och ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.
   

  

 Besvara följande urvalsfrågor (pdf, 228 kB) som en del av din ansökan.
   

  

 Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.
   

  

 De uppgifter du lämnar i samband med din ansökan kan användas för att kontakta dig, få information och kallelser samt eventuella anställningshandlingar.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan i form av CV och besvarade urvalsfrågor via e-post till jobb.vast@polisen.se senast den 7/10 2024. Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via den mailadress som anges i annonsen. Märk din ansökan med referensnummer A557.737/2024 i mailets ärendemening.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter, referenser eller liknande information som du själv bedömer som skyddsvärd rekommenderar vi att du kontaktar ansvarig HR-konsult innan du går vidare med din ansökan.
   

  

 En anställning hos Polismyndigheten kan komma att inledas med en provanställning om sex månader.
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) genomförs innan beslut om anställning fattas. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om krigsplacering och säkerhetsprövning under https://polisen.se/krigsplacering och https://polisen.se/sakerhetsprovning
   

  

 Polismyndigheten kommer att behandla dina personuppgifter i enlighet med reglerna i EU:s dataskyddsförordning (2016/679) och annan tillämplig dataskyddsreglering. Läs mer om vår hantering av personuppgifter på https://polisen.se/personuppgifter/rekrytering
   

  

 Din ansökan är en offentlig handling enligt offentlighetsprincipen.
   

  

 Polismyndigheten
   

  

 Polismyndigheten erbjuder dig en arbetsplats som stimulerar till mångfald, kreativitet och personlig utveckling. Läs gärna om våra förmåner som anställd hos polisen på https://polisen.se/erbjudande
   

  

 Vi bedriver vår verksamhet enligt vår värdegrund: engagemang, effektivitet och tillgänglighet. Som medarbetare inom polisen agerar du för likabehandling. Det är en förutsättning för rättssäkerhet, rättstrygghet och för polisens legitimitet i samhället. Som företrädare för polisen respekterar du allas lika värde och skapar förtroende för polisen.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om polisen och vår verksamhet på www.polisen.se
   

 www.polisen.se
   

  

 Sök jobbet
   

  

 Ansök via e-post

title: Postdoktor inom bröstcancerforskning
description:
**Vill du bidra till medicinsk forskning av toppkvalitet?**
 Institutionen för medicinsk epidemiologi och biostatistik bedriver forskning inom epidemiologi och biostatistik inom ett brett spektrum av områden inom biomedicinsk vetenskap. Institutionen är bland de största inom sitt område i Europa och har särskilt starka forskningsprofiler inom psykiatrisk, cancer-, reproduktiv, pediatrisk, farmakologisk, genetisk och geriatrisk epidemiologi, ätstörningar, precisionsmedicin, och biostatistik.
   

  

 En del av framgången för institutionen beror på vår samarbetsanda, där en stor bidragande faktor är att forskare vid institutionen delar och samfinansierar gemensamma resurser (som t.ex. IT och en tillämpad biostatistikgrupp). Institutionen ligger på campus Solna. Mer information finns på http://ki.se/meb.
   

  

**Vill du bidra till att förbättra bröstcancerpatienters hälsa genom träning?**
 Vår grupp bedriver klinisk forskning som baseras dels på register, dels på prospektiva studier. Målet är att individualisera och de-eskalera bröstcancerkirurgi för att minimera dess potentiellt negativa effekter på patienters livskvalitet utan att göra avkall på den onkologiska säkerheten. Utöver detta bedriver vi en stor randomiserade studie inom träningsonkologi, där vi har som mål att inte bara förbättra patienters livskvalitet under preoperativ cellgiftsbehandling men även att förbättra behandlingen effektivitet mot cancern.
   

  

 Vår forskningsgrupp för bröstcancerkirurgi utgörs av en kärna av doktorander och postdoktorer som samarbetar med multidisciplinära kollegor från områdena epidemiologi, biostatistik, onkologi, omvårdnad, träningsforskning, radiologi och patologi/translationell forskning. Vi har fokus på patientnära klinisk forskning med omfattande nationellt och internationellt samarbete.
   

  

 Mer information finns här
   

  

**Din roll**
 Vi utlyser nu en postdoktortjänst inom vår randomiserade träningsstudie Neo-ACT.
   

  

 Din roll kommer att vara den som främsta kontaktperson för alla deltagande sjukhus i allt som berör träningen och de fysiska testerna. Sjukhusen finns inte bara i Sverige men även i andra länder så som Australien, Tyskland, Finland m fl. Du kommer att ha ansvar för att monitorera deltagarnas träningsaktiviteter i en träningsapp och deras smartklockor (Fitbit), återkoppla med motivation och råd till deltagarna, se till att sjukhusen har allt stöd och material de behöver för att ta hand om sina deltagare, och monitorera svarsfrekvensen på studiens patientenkäter. Du kommer också att samordna och registrera insamling av blod- och vävnadsprover i studien (bara inom Stockholm). Utöver det kommer du att få samarbeta med teamet på Rörelseglädjen, ett träningslabb på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset, där du får lära dig utföra fysiska tester på deltagare och stötta dem i sin träning under studiens gång.
   

  

 Du kommer att jobba i vårt team med en validering av träningsinterventionen (som ges via en träningsapp), interimanalysen som ska utvärdera om interventionen åstadkommer tillräckligt hög träningsintensitet i interventionsgruppen, och andra undersökningar under studiens gång. Det finns tillfälle att påverka, diskutera och identifiera flera delstudier som kan vara av värde under studiens rekryteringsfas som förväntas fortsätta till slutet på år 2027.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att anställas som postdoktor krävs avlagd doktorsexamen eller en utländsk examen som bedöms motsvara en svensk doktorsexamen. Detta behörighetskrav ska vara uppfyllt senast vid tidpunkten då anställningsbeslutet fattas. Det är meriterande om du har avlagt din doktorsexamen inom de tre senaste åren, om det finns särskilda skäl kan din examen ha avlagts tidigare.
   

  

 Den sökande bör ha en bakgrund inom medicin, vårdvetenskap, idrottsmedicin eller epidemiologi. Det krävs att han/hon har tidigare erfarenhet av att föra metodologiska diskussioner, kritiskt värdera studiedesign och datakvalitet, och använda epidemiologiska och biostatistiska metoder för att studera hälsodata. Erfarenhet av projektledning eller -samordning är starkt meriterande. Tidigare erfarenheter inom cancer- eller träningsforskning är meriterande, och erfarenhet av att publicera forskningsartiklar är ett krav. Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt, är också ett krav, då gruppen är verksam i både nationella och internationella forskningsmiljöer. Praktisk erfarenhet inom svensk sjukvård är meriterande. Om en klinisk anställning föreligger kan ett eventuellt upplägg med viss deltidsanställning inom vården diskuteras.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper. Du är nyfiken, kollegial och har erfarenhet av att arbeta i forskningsteam. God organisationsförmåga, multitasking och bör kunna beskriva tidigare exempel på att ha utvecklat strukturerade metoder för att lösa oförutsedda och komplexa problem. Vi söker en positiv och kommunikativ person som trivs i både små team och internationella sammanhang, med stark drivkraft och intresse för att effektivt föra forskning i mål som direkt kommer våra cancerpatienter till gagn.
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi?**
 En kreativ, internationell inspirerande miljö fylld av kompetens och nyfikenhet. Karolinska Institutet är ett av världens ledande medicinska universitet. Här bedriver vi framgångsrik medicinsk forskning och har det största utbudet av medicinska utbildningar i Sverige. På KI får du träffa forskare med olika forskningsinriktningar som jobbar tillsammans. Det är det gränsöverskridande samarbetet som bidrar till KI:s världsledande position inom forskning. Flera av de personer du möter inom vården är utbildade på KI. En nära relationen till hälso- och sjukvården är viktig för att skapa utbildning och forskning av högsta kvalitet. Som universitet är Karolinska Institutet också en statlig myndighet. Det gör att du som anställd får goda förmåner genom vårt kollektivavtal.
   

  

*Tio skäl att välja Karolinska Institutet*
**Placering:** 
*Solna*
 Ansökan
   

  

 Ansökan ska bestå av följande handlingar, skrivna på engelska eller svenska:
   

  

* En komplett CV inkluderande disputationsdatum, avhandlingens titel, tidigare akademiska befattningar, akademisk titel, nuvarande befattning, akademiska utmärkelser samt kommittéarbete
* En komplett publikationslista
* En sammanfattning av nuvarande arbete (maximalt en sida)


 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Ansökan ska göras via rekryteringssystemet Varbi.
   

  

**Vill du göra skillnad – och bidra till en bättre hälsa för alla? Sök jobb hos oss**
