title: Teknisk Webbanalytiker
description:
Är du redo att omsätta din tekniska och analytiska skicklighet i spännande strategier för några av Sveriges ledande varumärken? På WGP letar vi nu efter en erfaren Teknisk Webbanalytiker som delar vår passion för insiktsfull data och kreativa lösningar. Om du är en person som ständigt strävar efter att utvecklas, trivs med utmaningar och njuter av att arbeta i ett dynamiskt team, då kan du vara den vi letar efter!


### **Om rollen**


Har du minst 4 års erfarenhet av Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager och en passion för implementation? Är du bekväm med BigQuery, SQL och har erfarenhet av Google Cloud eller liknande plattformar? Då kan du vara den vi söker!


I denna roll kommer du att spela en central roll i att optimera och driva tracking-implementationer för både webb och servermiljöer. Du hjälper våra kunder att få tillgång till rätt data och insikter, och bidrar aktivt till en datadriven kultur.


Du har erfarenhet av att hantera cookies och API:er samt är bekväm med att strukturera och felsöka datalager-pushar. Goda kunskaper i JavaScript, HTML/CSS samt erfarenhet av visualiseringsverktyg som Looker eller andra BI-verktyg är också viktiga delar av din profil.


Det är extra meriterande om du har kunskap om Python, R eller Matomo samt erfarenhet av att arbeta med Single Page Applications.


Som person är du analytisk, självgående och en lagspelare. Du har en prestigelös inställning, trivs med problemlösning och delar gärna din kunskap med andra.


#### **Vad du kommer att göra**


Som Teknisk Webbanalytiker på WGP kommer du att, bland annat, arbeta med:

* Framtagning, samt implementering, av mätplaner
* Implementering av Consent Management Platforms
* Client-side spårning
* Server-side uppsättning
* Designa och bygga dashboards / reports
* Granska och säkerställa datakvalitet

#### **Du är**


En problemlösare som gillar teknisk felsökning och som brinner för att lära dig nya saker, utforska lösningar och hålla koll på de senaste nyheterna. Din nyfikenhet sträcker sig bortom teknisk analys; du vill förstå våra kunder och deras unika utmaningar.


Du är noggrann och strukturerad, vilket gör dig till en utmärkt lagspelare. Din vilja att utvecklas driver dig till att ta dig an nya utmaningar och experimentera. Du är självgående och kan fatta beslut utifrån den data du har framför dig. Du har en förmåga att hantera olika arbetsuppgifter och projekt och prioritera därefter.


Om vi får önska, ser vi att du tar plats i möten för att presentera dina insikter och resultat, och bygger relationer med lätthet.


#### **Vi är**


WGP, en digital marknadsföringsbyrå som samarbetar med några av Sveriges största och mest etablerade varumärken. Våra expertområden inkluderar SEO, betalda kanaler, analys, sociala medier och content marketing.


Företagskulturen på WGP kan sammanfattas med orden balans, feedback och prestigelös framåtanda.


Vi tror på balans mellan fritid och arbete och mellan göra och lära – alltid med frihet under ansvar. Vi har en väl etablerad feedback-kultur vilket ger högt till tak och innebär att ingen framgång passerar obemärkt. Som en del av vårt team blir du en viktig spelare i att leverera insiktsfulla analyser och implementeringar som hjälper våra kunder att nå sina mål.


#### **Jobba hos WGP**


Hos oss får du möjlighet till kontinuerlig professionell utveckling genom våra interna utbildningar. Vi håller oss alltid a jour med marknadens senaste trender och utvecklingar, och du kommer att fördjupa dina kunskaper tillsammans med dina kollegor. Vi bryr oss om vår arbetsmiljö och ser till att alla trivs och mår bra. Vi är ett gäng som arbetar tillsammans som ett lag, och en after work är aldrig långt borta.

**Förmåner av att arbeta hos** **WGP inkluderar**:

* Ett flexibelt arbetssätt.
* Ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag.
* Tjänstepension och försäkringar.
* Möjligheten att arbeta med spännande projekt.
* Kompetenta och trevliga kollegor.
* Företagsevent och after works.
* Interna utbildningar.


#### **Övrigt**


Tjänsten är på heltid med placering på vårt kontor i Stockholm. Vi erbjuder flexibilitet med en arbetsplats som tillåter en kombination av kontors- och hemarbete.

**Processen:** Vi tar emot ansökningar löpande. Vänta inte med din ansökan, eftersom tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Urval sker genom intervjuer och arbetsprov.

title: Senior Cloud Security Architect
description:
Vi har nu ett behov hos en kund efter en Cloud Security Architect och söker därför en kollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd som konsult och arbetar hos kund alt. interna åtaganden gentemot våra kunder.  

  

**Vår ambitioner**  

Vår målsättning är att vara det ledande IT-konsultföretaget med de mest nöjda medarbetarna och kunderna. Hos oss arbetar du inte för cheferna – ledarskapet är här för att stötta dig. Vi sätter dig i centrum och strävar efter att du ska utvecklas och växa. Vi erbjuder en inspirerande arbetsmiljö med god stämning, intressanta projekt hos intressanta kunder och en stark kultur av kunskapsdelning. Vi har tilltro till våra medarbetares innovationskraft och ger dig och dina kollegor möjlighet att både utvidga och fördjupa era kunskaper.  

  

**Jobbeskrivning**  

Vår kund söker en konsult för att hjälpa till att definiera nästa generations molnsäkerhetsarkitektur. Vi föreställer oss en hybridarkitekturlösning som kombinerar multicloud-funktioner med on-prem-lösningar. Som en del av arkitekturen ser vi behovet av att definiera adekvata och proportionella säkerhetsfunktioner, inklusive relevanta krav.  

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* Företagssäkerhetsarkitektur för hybridmiljöer
* Säkerhetsarkitektur för Microsoft Azure, On-prem och Google Cloud Platform
* Säkerhetsfunktionalitet och verktyg som stödjer företags- och molnsäkerhetsarkitektur
* Beskriva en teknisk och organisatorisk transformationsväg från nuvarande tillstånd till nästa generations arkitektur
* Dokumentera arkitekturramverk och processer
* Facilitera och leda workshops med andra experter
* Kommunicera med fokus på att förklara komplexa idéer och ge råd och feedback
* Identifiera säkerhetsutmaningar och säkerhetsrisker inom molnsäkerhetsområdet

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 25-09-2024 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 **Om Deploja**  

Vi sysselsätter idag seniora IT-specialister, inom bl.a. utveckling, test, testledning, projektledning, databas, Drift, Linux och ser oss alltid om efter fler kompetenta medarbetare.  

  

Transparens och flexibilitet är i alla fall viktigt för oss, med oss får man som konsult majoriteten av sin egen intäkt, i snitt har våra medarbetare höjt sin ersättning med 43% och har samtidigt ett av marknadens bästa förmånspaket. De som är med på vår resa idag har en trygg anställning MEN sätter sin egen lön och bestämmer själva över sina förmåner så som pension, utbildning, arbetstid och tjänstebil.


Våra kunder finns bland annat inom detaljhandel, bank/finans/försäkring, energi, transport och offentlig sektor. De flesta av våra kunder är i Stockholmsregionen men vi har även kunder i andra delar av landet.  

  

Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket och semestertider dröjer återkoppling längre än vanligt.

title: Junior Systemingenjör till Saab Surveillance
description:
**Tog du nyligen examen inom elektroteknik och vill arbeta med mikrovågsteknologi? Saab Surveillance söker nu en nyexaminerad systemingenjör med intresse för radarutveckling.** **Rollen är kopplad till ett talangprogram som ger dig den ultimata övergången mellan studier och arbetsliv.**

**Att jobba som junior systemingenjör på Saab Surveillance**

Som junior systemingenjör kommer du att ingå i ett team som arbetar brett kring produktutvecklingens alla faser. Du kommer arbeta i en sektion inom Radar, idag bestående av 17 personer som ansvarar för verifiering på antennmätsträckor. Teamet arbetar med mikrovågskontroller på apparatnivå.


Du kommer att arbeta med RF i teknikens framkant. Du kommer bland annat hantera kravställningen från systemnivån som påverkar tex antennen och dess funktionalitet. Det innebär också ett tvärfunktionellt samarbete med andra teknikområden såsom mjukvara och elektronik. Arbetet utförs även i labbmiljö där du hanterar och förbereder den utrustning som ska användas under verifiering. Du genomför verifiering och analyserar resultat och dokumenterar resultat.


Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bland annat bestå av att:


* Verifiera och analysera funktion och prestanda.
* Ta fram produktionsunderlag och stötta vid integration av produkten.
* Arbeta med mikrovågssystem och tekniker inom digitalt, mekanik och embedded mjukvara.

Rollen är placerad i Göteborg.  

  

  



**Att vara konsult på Nexer Tech Talent**


Nexer Tech Talent är specialister på att ge unga techtalanger den ultimata starten på arbetslivet. För denna roll kommer du att bli anställd av Nexer Tech Talent men arbeta hos Saab Surveillance kontor i Kallebäck med start efter sommaren. Du kommer även att få ta del av ett skräddarsytt utbildningsprogram där du får möjlighet att utveckla och fördjupa dina tekniska kunskaper i områden som AI, Cloud och cybersäkerhet, men även inom tex. ledarskap och personlig utveckling.


Du kommer att coachas av en mentor hos Saab Surveillance samt en konsultchef på Nexer Tech Talent. Som konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och bjuds in på gemensamma aktiviteter så som föreläsningar, afterwork och lunchträffar. Efter framgångsrikt genomförande av konsultuppdraget är intentionen att du erbjuds en anställning hos Saab.


**Vi söker dig som:**

  

* Är i början av din karriär och har en master inom elektroteknik eller teknisk fysik
* Har ett intresse för konstruktion inom elektronik
* Som person är social och ordningsam
* Du har ett intresse för mikrovågs och radarsystem
* Har goda kunskaper i svenska i såväl tal som skrift
* Har goda kunskaper i MATLAB
Det är meriterande om du skriver ditt exjobb eller arbetat vid sidan av studierna inom radar eller mikrovågs elektronik  
* 

  

**Ansökan**

  

Låter detta som något för dig? Vi arbetar löpande med rekryteringen, så skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt. Om du har du frågor eller funderingar är du välkommen att kontakta Tech Recruiter Johanna Norman på johanna.norman@nexergroup.com


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

  

För företag inom försvars- och säkerhetsindustrin i Sverige, kräver lagen att anställda som hanterar känslig information och teknologi ska vara svenska medborgare samt genomgå en säkerhetsprövning.

**Om Nexer Tech Talent**

*Nexer Tech Talent är en del av Nexer Group – ett techbolag med djupa rötter i svenskt entreprenörskap och innovation. Tillsammans är vi över 2500 medarbetare i 15 länder som i mer än 35 år hjälpt våra kunder att ligga steget före både strategiskt, teknologiskt och kommunikativt. Läs mer om Nexer Tech Talent* *här**.*  

  



**Om Saab**


Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 19 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare, mer hållbar och mer rättvis värld. Saab är också ett möjligheternas företag. Ett företag där du som medarbetare får stort ansvar och goda utvecklingsmöjligheter. Men också ett företag som respekterar varje människas behov av ett liv utanför arbetet. Saab ser mångfald som en tillgång och ständigt lärande som en självklarhet. Tekniskt är de ledande inom många områden och en femtedel av våra intäkter går till forskning och utveckling.

title: Financial Data Analyst
description:
**As a Financial Data Analyst, you will strengthen our Data Delivery function within the area of Data & Analytics. You have a key role in the success of data product deliveries. Working in one of our agile Data Delivery teams, you will develop new and maintain existing data integration into our data platform for Finance, Compliance, and Risk. The data platform is hybrid on-prem and cloud build upon AWS, Informatica and Oracle technology. You will be acting as a subject matter expert in all aspects of business requirements, data availability and data quality of the enterprise data warehouse. You collaborate closely with Tech Leads, Data Engineers, Business Intelligence developers and Product Owners to develop features through the Agile Release Trains.**


### **Responsibilities**


* Solution and Impact Analysis – Define implementation approach – Define validation approach.
* Data Analysis – Analyzing data and process to complete functional and technical data requirements definition (input for data engineer).
* Implementation – Coordination with data engineers and source systems, other components, and data consumers.
* Validation – Coordination and execution support of testing activities and mitigating actions.

  


**Requirements**


* Strong understanding of banking processes and ability to discuss requirements with business stakeholders.
* Proven experience of working with data analysis and data requirement management.
* Excellent proficiency in mapping and analyzing data.
* Experience in holding conversations with business stakeholders to understand business processes and related data.
* Ability to transform business requirements to technical requirements and specifications towards other developers and peers.
* Being structured and analytical and can conceptualize complex technical issues.
* Experience working with Data Warehouses, is an added advantage.
* Experience and knowledge of agile frameworks, preferably SAFe.
* Excellent proficiency in SQL to analyze, validate and signoff data.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* You are organized with strong time-management skills.
* Excellent English communication skills (written and verbal).

title: Solution Advisor Specialist, Sweden, Signavio
description:
**We help the world run better**

At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.

**What you'll do**  

  

To thrive in this role you are someone who appreciates close collaboration, open communication, and feedback.  

You will be expected to:  

* Strategize, prepare and deliver engaging solution demonstrations, presentations and business cases to prospects and clients that lead to successful sales outcomes with Signavio’s products and services.
* Lead technical process mining evaluations (Proof of Concepts) requiring large-scale data manipulation scenarios.
* Respond to Request for Proposals (RFPs) (functional, technical, security aspects) and deliver timely, detailed, and well-crafted follow-up reports and presentations to client and prospect requests for additional information.
* Develop and maintain expert knowledge of Signavio’s solution suite, competitive product offerings, market intelligence, and unique differentiation.
* Collaborate with Sales enablement and product teams to share market insight and solutions, and work with post-sales delivery teams to ensure long term customer success.
* Provide thought leadership, technical expertise and best practice knowledge around process mining and process management to our prospects and customers.


  

**What you bring**  

* Presales and Enterprise Solution Consulting experience, ideally within the field of Business Process Management
* Deep understanding of key business processes, such as Order-to-Cash, Procure-to-Pay, Make-to-Order, etc.
* A self-starter, you show initiative and enjoy being part of a great team in an international organization.
* Strong presentation and communication skills.
* Familiarity with major ERP systems, data extraction, data analysis, reporting is an advantage.
* Familiarity with process mining and process mining applications.
* Strong analytical skills including value analysis, business case development, ROI calculations, etc.
* Ability to juggle multiple projects among multiple stakeholders (internal and external) simultaneously.
* Willingness to travel e.g. 30%.
* Bachelor’s Degree (or higher) in Computer Science, Business Information Technologies or equivalent experience.


  

**Meet your team**  

  

In this role you will be working in a cross-functional team who values trust, respect and diversity. We are looking for people who share our passion for creating products that people love to use.  

**Bring out your best**


SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.

**We win with inclusion**


SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.  

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com  

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

**EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:**


Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.  

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.


Requisition ID: 404125 | Work Area: Presales | Expected Travel: 0 - 30% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: #LI-Hybrid.
company_description: SAP's purpose is to help the world run better and improve people's lives with sustainability at the core.

title: Lead ML/MLOps Engineer- Hybrid / Remote
description:
What's the role?:

The Product Trust team is looking for a ML/MLOps Engineer to help streamline our state-of-the-art tools and processes for helping developer achieve compliance. title: Research fellowship in joint analysis of infrared and microwave radiances
description:
Today, microwave and infrared cloud observations are largely used separately, even though it is commonly accepted that they provide complementary measurement information. This project aims at bridging the gap between the two wavelength regions to improve the use of the observations in the derivation of climate data and weather forecasting. The project is timely considering the upcoming launches of the first sub-millimetre operational sensors (AWS and ICI). The position is a fellowship funded by EUMETSAT, placed at the Division of Geoscience and Remote Sensing at Chalmers University of Technology (Gothenburg, Sweden). We are now inviting applications from suitably qualified scientists from EUMETSAT’s member states.


**About EUMETSAT**  

EUMETSAT is Europe’s meteorological satellite agency. Its role is to establish and operate meteorological satellites to monitor the weather and climate from space - 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. This information is supplied to the national meteorological services of the organisation's member states in Europe, as well as other users worldwide. EUMETSAT also operates several Copernicus missions on behalf of the European Union and provide data services to the Copernicus marine and atmospheric services and their users. As an intergovernmental European Organisation, EUMETSAT has 30 Member States (Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, The Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia,Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey and the United Kingdom.)


**About the division at Chalmers**  

The Geoscience and Remote Sensing division at Chalmers conducts research, education, and utilisation within various scientific and engineering disciplines, including ground-based, airborne and satellite measurements, numerical modelling and data analysis. The division's goals are to improve understanding of the Earth system and global environmental problems and provide and interpret global datasets. We pursue scientific knowledge and provide tools to tackle problems of importance to society, such as climate change, Earth system science, air pollution, natural hazards and monitoring of the Earth's surface. We have extensive experience in developing and applying remote sensing across the electromagnetic spectrum and studying problems at different scales, from molecular processes in clouds to global environmental change. Our setting is distinctive in Sweden in that we have expertise in developing measurement techniques and modelling and methods to combine data from observations and models through data assimilation and machine learning methods.


**Area of reserach**  

Microwave all-sky assimilation is a proven concept today, while infrared correspondence is in early development. Climate ice cloud products show a reversed situation; multiple examples based on infrared measurements exist, while passive microwave data, at best, provide background information. There are several reasons for this situation, but already differences in terminology and assumptions on particle sizes and shapes made for the two wavelength regions hamper the progress. This project aims to establish a common ground, particularly to develop and apply particle model parametrisations that allows joint treatment of infrared and microwave radiances. The launch of the Arctic Weather Satellite (AWS) in August this year and the upcoming launch of the Ice Cloud Imager (ICI, 2025) give urgency to the project, but also result in that completely new data will be at hand for constraining particle models. The project will be performed in collaboration with the Swedish Meteorological and Hydrological Institute (SMHI), ECMWF and EUMETSAT.



Main work tasks are:


* Assess the different assumptions and approaches presently used in the infrared  

and microwave radiative transfer, by comparing observed and simulated  

observations using the ARTS (Atmospheric Radiative Transfer Simulator)  

research tool.
* Based on the findings, develop particle model parametrisations for different  

cloud regimes, suitable to reach the project’s objectives.
* Take part in incorporating new models into cloud retrievals made at Chalmers  

and SMHI, as well as supporting ECMWF to add the models into the operational  

RTTOV-SCATT observation operator.

  

  

**Qualifications**  

The fellow should have a university degree in physics, mathematics, meteorology, remote sensing, or equivalent, and relevant research experience, including PhD or at the level thereof. Experience in microwave and/or infrared, all-sky, radiative transfer will be emphasised. Knowledge in one or more of the following areas would also be an advantage: retrievals, data assimilation, numerical weather forecasting and cloud physics. Strong computing skills will be a significant asset. This includes good and proven practical knowledge of programming languages (particularly C/C++ and Python), as well as experience with performing scientific simulations, and their evaluation. The ability to work as part of a team, a high level of commitment and interest in continuing development and training is required. Candidates must be able to work effectively in English, both verbally and written. Swedish is not a requirement but Chalmers offers Swedish courses.


**Duration**  

The fellowship is offered for one year, with possibility of extension for up to two  

additional years.


**We offer**  

Chalmers offers a cultivating and inspiring working environment in the coastal city of Gothenburg.  

Read more about working at Chalmers and our benefits for employees.  

  

Chalmers aims to actively improve our gender balance. We work broadly with equality projects, for example the GENIE Initiative on gender equality for excellence. Equality and diversity are substantial foundations in all activities at Chalmers.  

  

EUMETSAT is committed to providing an equal opportunities work environment for men and women. Please note that only nationals of EUMETSAT member states may apply. The EUMETSAT convention requires that its staff shall be recruited on the basis of their qualifications, account being taken of the international character of EUMETSAT.


**Application procedure**


*The application should be marked with* *20230793* *and written in English. The application should be sent electronically and be attached as PDF-files, as below. Maximum size for each file is 40 MB. Please note that the system does not support Zip files.*  

  

**CV:** *(Please name the document as: CV, Surname, Ref. number)* including:  

* CV, include complete list of publications
* Previous teaching and pedagogical experiences
* Two references that we can contact.

  

**Personal letter:** *(Please name the document as: Personal letter, Family name, Ref. number)*  

1-3 pages where you:  

* Introduce yourself
* Describe your previous research fields and main research results
* Describe your future goals and future research focus

  

**Other documents:**  

* Attested copies of completed education, grades and other certificates.

  

Use the button at the foot of the page to reach the application form.  

  

**Application deadline: 2024-10-21**  

  

**For questions, please contact:**  

Prof. Patrick Eriksson, Geoscience and remote sensing, Dept. Space, Earth and  

Environment  

Email: patrick.eriksson@chalmers.se  

*\*\*\* Chalmers declines to consider all offers of further announcement publishing or other types of support for the recruiting process in connection with this position.* \*\*\*

  


  

*Chalmers University of Technology conducts research and education in engineering sciences, architecture, technology-related mathematical sciences, natural and nautical sciences, working in close collaboration with industry and society. The strategy for scientific excellence focuses on our six Areas of Advance; Energy, Health Engineering, Information and Communication Technology, Materials Science, Production and Transport. The aim is to make an active contribution to a sustainable future using the basic sciences as a foundation and innovation and entrepreneurship as the central driving forces. Chalmers has around 11,000 students and 3,000 employees. New knowledge and improved technology have characterised Chalmers since its foundation in 1829, completely in accordance with the will of William Chalmers and his motto: Avancez!*

title: Artworker - Sweden
description:
### **Description**

  

**Role type:** 40 hours per week, 1 year contract with possible extension
  

**Salary:** SEK 312,000 - SEK 360,000 per year
  

**Location:** Stockholm hybrid **Diversity matters**
We are building a brand that represents the people of the world. It’s what you do that counts, and we are always looking to expand perspectives and voices to shape our future.  

We see you, we celebrate you, we want you!  

**Who we are**  

You might know us as the inventors of the bath bomb, but there’s more to this great-smelling, partly employee-owned, family-run company than pioneering cosmetics. We believe our business should put more back into the world than it takes and demonstrate that capitalism can be a force for good.  

  

The Living Wage Foundation’s statement 'a hard day's work deserves a fair day's pay' is one that we are proud to commit to in the UK. As an accredited Living Wage employer, we put our people first and fight cruel practices like animal testing, promote regeneration, and show that it is what’s inside that counts - whether that’s an ingredient in a product, or the minerals in a smartphone.
  

  

Joining the support team for Lush Sweden means you will join a small local team where departments are responsible for their own tasks but also collaborate and help each other run the 7 local shops and local website, as well as acting support team for Lush Norway where we currently have 1 shop. You will also work together with the global artwork team, with colleagues from all over the world.
  

  

We're seeking someone with a keen eye for detail and solid organizational skills. This person can react effectively to a busy workflow schedule and provide great-looking, technically accurate artwork within tight deadlines and with an innovative approach.  

  

**Please Note: All applications must be submitted in English. Applications submitted in other languages will not be considered.**  

### **Key Responsibilities**

  

* Localisation and creation of artwork assets such as labels, signage and flyers using a range of Adobe Creative Cloud software.
* Ensuring artwork is consistent, accurate and in line with Lush brand guidelines.
* Setting up artwork for print processes.
* Carrying out proof checks prior to print.
* Order handling and contact with external printers.
* Localisation of ingredient lists based on the EU standard with the help of translation tools.
* Managing files in different systems.
* Helping out with copywriter tasks when necessary.

### **Skills, Knowledge and Expertise**

  

* Relevant education in communication/content creation/graphic design or equivalent work experience - preferably university studies or higher vocational education.
* Adobe Creative Cloud Suite, mainly InDesign and Illustrator.
* Highly organised and able to manage different types of content and files deliberately and methodically.
* Flexible and able to respond to changing priorities.
* Self-motivated with a drive to complete tasks with little supervision.
* Excellent time management skills and ability to work against set deadlines.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, not only for the work but also in liaising with global teams.
* Creative with an eye for composition and design.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.
* Detail-oriented.
* An interest in the cosmetics industry.

### **Benefits**

  

* Lush Sweden is connected to union agreements (kollektivavtal); for shop staff “*Detaljhandelsavtalet*” with Handelsanställdas förbund and for support staff “*Kollektivavtalet för tjänstemän inom detaljhandeln*” with Unionen.
* 25 yearly vacation days
* Bonus programme
* Employee Assistance Programme provided through Health Assured
* Health care allowance (Friskvårdsbidrag)
* Terminal/monitor glasses (if needed)
* Occupational health care
* 50% staff discount
* Birthdays off

### **About Lush**


Since establishing in 1995 in Poole, Dorset, Lush has been driven by innovation and its ethics.  

Creators of pioneering beauty products such as the fizzing bath bomb, shower jellies and solid shampoo bars, we place emphasis on fresh ingredients like organic fruits and vegetables, fight against animal testing and combat over-packaging by developing products that can be sold ‘naked’ to the customer without any packaging.  

  

We currently operate in 52 countries with 928 global shops. Through our separate business divisions we invent, manufacture and sell our handmade products direct to our customers through our own shops and online. The fact that we make all our products by hand is something we are really rather proud of!  

  

Lush is 10% Employee Owned since 2017 and our people are the heart and soul of our business.  

  

In the UK we currently have offices located in Poole, Dorset and Soho, London.
company_description: You might know Lush as the inventors of the bath bomb, but there’s more to this great-smelling, privately-owned, family-run company than pioneering cosmetics.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
Avalanche Studios Group (ASG) is looking for an experienced Analytics Engineer to join our data team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for creating, designing and maintaining our data architecture. This role requires a deep understanding of data engineering, data modeling, data visualization, event design and best practices in those areas.  

This is a key role in developing our data lake by bridging the gap between our data engineer and our data scientists as well as ensuring that our data is timely, easy to work with and trusted across the company.**What you'll do** **Clean and transform data for analytical use:*** Develop and implement processes to extract, clean, and transform data from various sources to ensure it is ready for analysis.
* Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to understand their data needs and provide them with reliable datasets.
* Design and implement data models and aggregated history tables for all major KPI’s and user history.
* Design and implement data models that support business needs and analytics requirements.

 **Maintain data documentation and definitions:*** Create and maintain comprehensive data documentation, including data dictionaries, schemas, and metadata.
* Ensure that data definitions are consistent and easily accessible to all stakeholders.
* Ensure data quality, integrity, and availability:
* Implement automated data quality checks and validation processes to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data.
* Monitor data pipelines and systems to ensure high availability and performance alongside our data engineer.
* Help the game teams and analysts in designing the events that our games log as well as their associated triggers

 **Share best practices across the organization:*** Promote a culture of data excellence by sharing best practices and providing training.
* Stay updated with the latest trends and technologies in data engineering and analytics and share knowledge with the team.
* Write efficient, maintainable, and scalable analytics code using best practices.
* Conduct code and SQL reviews and provide feedback to ensure high standards of code quality within the team.

 **Who you are*** Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience as an Analytics Engineer, Data Architect, or similar role.
* Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with data modeling tools and techniques.
* Experience with ETL processes and tools (e.g., Apache Airflow, Talend, DBT etc.).
* Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure). GCP is a big plus.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
* Passion for gaming and a deep understanding of the gaming industry is a plus.

 *Research shows that under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply for a job if they don't check off every requirement. Here at Avalanche Studios Group we're more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what's on your resume. So, don't stress if you don't hit every mark— give it a shot and apply! Diversity of opinion and experience make our teams even better.* **The Stockholm location**
Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp. **About us**
Avalanche Studios Group is a game developer and publisher that defined and evolved open-world games, offering an amazing portfolio of fantastic games across multiple genres, including the Just Cause franchise, Rage 2, theHunter: Call of the Wild, Generation Zero, and Second Extinction as part of its portfolio. **Employee promise**
We provide goals, instead of instructions, and the opportunity to do the best work of your career. **Our Values**
At Avalanche Studios Group, we believe in worlds beyond limits, and we are committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. Everyone at Avalanche Studios Group has a shared responsibility to create an open and inclusive work environment where everyone is treated equally and with respect. Being part of our world is not contingent on where you’re from, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity. **How to Apply**
We will only consider applications that consist of both a cover letter and a CV. In your cover letter, you should include why you want to work at Avalanche Studios Group. For this role, you need to be able to work from within our Stockholm Studio, alongside the strategic partnerships team. We apply a hybrid work model that enables you to work some days from home and some days from the office.
company_description: Avalanche Studios is the original creator of the award-winning Just Cause franchise (published by Square Enix) with the third entry release

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**Executive Assistant to Head of Volvo Group Digital & IT, Technology**
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

Volvo Group Digital & IT is looking for an experienced Executive Assistant to support SVP Technology.  

The Technology Function has the ambition to develop, modernize and operate a resilient and stable digital backbone, i.e. the Core Platform Areas, to enable speed, efficiency and effectiveness in operations and business process development.  

We are accelerating use of Digital Technologies such as Mobile apps/XR, RPA, and IoT, and are also providing Foundational products, platforms and modernization capabilities such as cloud, integration and DevSecOps. All to enable feature product teams to be increasingly efficient and self-serviced.  

This function works in tight cooperation with other functions within Volvo Group Digital & IT (e.g. Digital Delivery, IOS, Data, Finance, People & Culture) and with Digital & IT organizations in other Truck Divisions, Business Areas.

 **About the position**  

The role has the responsibility to assist and support with administrative tasks, to be the sounding board to the SVP Technology and to coordinate and drive own projects.  

You report to SVP Technology and will be part of the Technology management team. In addition to being part of the management team you will also be part of the EA network within Volvo Group Digital & IT.

 **This is the role:**  

* Proactive ownership of the SVP´s agenda, ability to coordinate complex meetings and projects by working directly with key stakeholders. Proven ability to plan and manage time effectively.
* Managing the SVP´s inbox, ensuring all duties are completed in a prioritized and organized way.
* Obtaining and organizing information for use in conferences, speeches, and reports. Editing, proofing and formatting documents and research incl. basic authoring/drafting of correspondence.
* Drive and coordinate projects
* Coordinate and assist in the SVP´s management team meetings and other key D&IT governance meetings, incl. agenda, minutes and follow-up on actions and decisions.
* Manage administration, e.g., travel administration, purchase orders, invoices, and other expenses.
* Assist overseas visitors with practical support.
**Who are you?**
----------------


To be effective in this position we think you should have or be:

* Advanced knowledge typically obtained through education and relevant work experience as assistant on a senior executive level (>5 years).
* A good listener with high integrity; transmitting information accurately and understandably and actively seeking feedback. Handling highly confidential information and protecting the privacy of information in a correct way.
* Flexible and able to perform a wide range of tasks, responding to changes in direction and priorities and accepting new challenges and responsibilities. You should be self-dependent in the absence of specific instructions or requirements.
* You have a strong business acumen and a clear customer-centric mindset and are experienced in handling a wide range of administrative and executive support.
* Your professional behavior towards both internal and external influential stakeholders is both agile and representative.
* You pay attention to details and have a high level of professionalism; you deal directly and forthrightly with people and problems; you are persistent in getting the job done.
* Good at planning and organizing; taking the lead and accepting responsibility for actions, costs and results.
* You actively strive for continuous development and to develop your capabilities in the role.
* You are an experienced user of IT tools e.g. Microsoft Office, SharePoint/Teams, SAP/R3, EBD, SuccessFactors and other support tools for administration in Volvo Group
* You are fluent in English (written and spoken)
**Are we the right match for you?**
-----------------------------------

Volvo Group values are Customer Success, Trust, Passion, Change and Performance. If you believe that they are keys to success, you might be our new Executive Assistant.


You will have the opportunity to work together with highly skilled colleagues in an exciting global environment which provides opportunities to develop both professionally and personally.


We believe our new Executive Assistant is above all an effective coordinator and team player, embracing all aspects of diversity, safety, quality, and the environment.


If this sounds interesting, we hope to hear more from you. Interviews will be performed continuously during the summer.

**City/Town** Gothenburg/Bangalore


**Functional area** Volvo Group Digital & IT

**Employment type** Regular

**Travel required (minimum)** Travel might occur.


Senior Vice President Technology Dayasindhu Sakrepatna


Function People & Culture Partner M Manu

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Digital & IT** is the hub for digital development within Volvo Group. Imagine yourself working with cutting-edge technologies in a global team, represented in more than 30 countries. We are dedicated to leading the way of tomorrow’s transport solutions, guided by a strong customer mindset and high level of curiosity, both as individuals and as a team. Here, you will thrive in your career in an environment where your voice is heard and your ideas matter.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Cloud Security Architect
description:
**Start****29-09-2024****Duration****1-3 months**
  
**SME Cloud Security Architecture**


emagine is looking for a consultant to help define next generation cloud security architecture. We envision a hyrbrid architecture solution combining multi-cloud capabilities with on-prem solutions. As part of the architecture we see the definition of adequate and proportional security functions including relevant requirements.

**Role:** Cloud Security Architect  

**Level:** Nivå 5  

**Period:** 2024-09-30 - 2024-12-20  

**Stationeringsort:** Solna  

  

**Profil & Meriter**


We require someone with experience about

* Enterprise security architecture for hybrid environments
* Security architecture for Microsoft Azure, On-prem and Google Cloud Platform
* Security functionality and tools supporting the Enterprise- and Cloud Security architecture
* Describing a technical and organizational transformation path from current state to the next generation architecture
* Documenting architectural frameworks and processes
* Facilitating and leading workshops with other experts
* Communicating with focus on explaining complex ideas and giving advice and feedback.
* Identifying security challenges and security risks within cloud security area

title: App & Web Analyst
description:
We are Strawberry. With over 225 hotels, 120 restaurants, 20 spas and more, we create thousands of experiences every day. With urban Comfort Hotel®, warm Quality Hotel™, stylish Clarion Hotel® and cosy Clarion Collection® Hotel and more than 40 unique independent hotels, our guests can pick and choose. Our team of 17 000 passionate individuals from more than 120 countries is what makes up our company – diversity is what makes us grow! Strawberry is built on our core values: energy, courage and enthusiasm.
We are looking for an **App & Web Analyst** to take responsibility for building and maintaining a solid foundation of statistics and insights from the usage of our apps.



Our goal is to create seamless and engaging digital experiences for our users, ensuring that our apps and web platforms continuously evolve to meet their needs. To achieve this, we need you – an analyst with a keen eye for data, insights, and solutions to take our app and web analytics to the next level. If you have experience in app tracking, web analytics, and have worked with data that drives product development and business decisions, we would love to talk to you!


### **What you will be doing:**



You will work closely with our Web Analyst as a sparring partner, contributing to our Personalization journey. The knowledge you gain from app usage plays a significant role in our ongoing personalization efforts, and your insights will shape how the app evolves moving forward. In this role, you will also align the app tracking strategy with our web analytics to ensure a seamless and complete overview of the Digital Direct experience and performance.



Your main stakeholders will include Digital Product, Sales, and Marketing teams. You will work closely with them daily, delivering data and insights that inform decision-making, product development and iteration, as well as sales and marketing activations.  

  

**Your main responsibilities:**



Given our extensive range of services and products, you’ll need to navigate a large and complex landscape. This means you'll need to be creative, resourceful, and able to tap into multiple resources to gather the data required to understand various aspects of the app's performance.


* Manage, document, and evolve our app tracking strategy.
* Align app tracking with our web tracking for a unified experience.
* Use data insights to influence the roadmap for app development and marketing activities.
* Monitor, report, and proactively deliver insights from app usage.
* Create data-driven artifacts for stakeholders and promote self-service data analytics.
* Collect data from various sources and align it with app tracking.

### **Who we think you are:**



We are looking for someone with deep knowledge of app tracking strategies and implementation. You have strong communication skills, particularly in English, as we are a multilingual company. You bring solid experience in data and analytics, and are familiar with tools such as Looker Studio, DW, PBI/Tableau, SQL, and BigQuery/Google Cloud. Additionally, you have experience in Product Analytics and Product Management.


**Your skills and qualifications:**


* 2+ years of experience working with app tracking.
* Experience with Google Analytics and MixPanel.
* Proven experience working in cross-functional teams.
* Background in experimentation, optimization, product management, and analytics.

### **We will offer you:**


* The opportunity to influence the creation of a member journey which impacts end-user value directly
* Exceptional colleagues and an inclusive, experimentation-based, and innovative culture - we love to share and learn from each other, and test ideas if they work
* A flat organization with trust and autonomy in your work - we are rebels that support innovation without imposing strict corporate rules
* Plenty of social events including smaller gatherings with your team and huge get-togethers with the whole Strawberry family
* Great benefits! In addition to our collective agreement we also offer staff discounts and friends & family rates at our 200+ hotels.

### Sounds interesting?



If you're ready to embark on this exciting journey with us, we'd love to hear from you! Interviews will be held on a rolling basis, don’t wait to submit your application!
company_description: We are Strawberry. With over 225 hotels, 120 restaurants, 20 spas and more, we create thousands of experiences every day. Join a world of experiences!

title: Senior ASIC Verification Engineer
description:
Senior ASIC Verification Engineer


Swedium Global is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model. Swedium Global is having presence in Sweden, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic and in India.


**Location:** Sweden


**Expected Start date:** ASAP


**Job Name**: **Senior ASIC Verification Engineer**

  

  

**Assignment description**


We are looking for a Top Level Verification engineer!


As a Top level verification engineer you will verify complex state-of- the-art ASIC and FPGA for 5G as part of the product portfolio. You will together with the team analyze the design, implement, and execute drivers and tests on system level for ASIC and FPGA. Much of the verification is SW based. Tests and drivers are mainly written in C.


Our organization works in accordance to the Lean and Agile principles with close team interaction. It is important to give fast feedback on the quality of the design to the projects. You will participate in daily and periodic agile meetings and continuously improve and optimize ways of working.

  


Requirements


* BSc or MSc level in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent education.


* At least 5 years of relevant work experience.


* Experienced in C programming


* Experience in VHDL and Verilog language


* Knowledge in scripting languages (Python, Perl, Linux Shell scripting etc.)


* Communication and presentation skills in English are essential.

  


**Following experience will be a beneficial asset**


* Experiences in Formal verification.


* Knowledge about mobile communication standards.


* Embedded CPUs (ARM based).


* Knowledge about several standard interfaces, such as Ethernet, I3C, SPI, SGMII, CPRI etc.

  


**You can reach out to us at** **Pratik.pandey@swediumglobal.com** **or** **hr@swediumglobal.com**


  
Job Overview


* Location : Lund, Sweden
* Vacancy : 1
* Key Skills : C based Top Level ASIC Verification

title: Senior RF Engineer
description:
Senior RF Engineer


Swedium Global is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model. Swedium Global is having presence in Sweden, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic and in India.


**Location:** Sweden


**Expected Start date:** ASAP


**Job Name**: **Senior RF Engineer**

  

  

**Assignment description**


We are looking for an RF engineer!  

  

The ideal candidate will have the skills necessary all the way from architectural choices, specification and implementation of IP-blocks to validation of the component in lab.  

  

**Below is the areas that we are looking candidates for. Do you have experience from these?**  

1: PCB focus: Layout and simulations (HFS Ansys) of IC PCB manufacturing 20 GHz and up.  

2: RF Measurements: Practical experience with RF measurements preferably in higher frequencies (20+).  

3: RF converter: High end ADC/DAC measurements.  

4: Data processing: Data analysis and visualization including building test environment/tools.  

  

**Responsibilities & Tasks**  

* Validation and evaluation of the RFIC in the lab
* Close collaboration and troubleshooting with the designers of each IP
* Development of Test Environment SW
* Project specific test cases, Instrument drivers and Test environment improvements
* Supporting test board development
* Result handling, including presentation of results and reporting


  

**Requirements**  

* MSEE or PhD degree.
* Skill to perform IC measurements


-Experience of mm- wave design is beneficial  

* Experience with state-of-the-art instruments
* Previous experience with cellular standards
* Communication and presentation ability in English
* Highly motivated, self-driven way of working
* Good cooperation skill

**You can reach out to us at** **Pratik.pandey@swediumglobal.com** **or** **hr@swediumglobal.com**


  
Job Overview


* Location : Lund, Sweden
* Vacancy : 1
* Key Skills : RF, ANSYS, ADC/DAC,

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about building and optimising robust infrastructure solutions for the energy sector in a consultancy environment? Want to play a key role in developing cutting-edge platforms and automation pipelines for a diverse client base, where you'll tackle complex CI/CD challenges and create impactful solutions with a focus on scalable, resilient infrastructure?
 



  





**What's in it for you?** 




 You'll join a dynamic team of software engineers and data scientists, specialising in custom product development for the energy industry. Your role will primarily focus on DevOps and platform engineering, allowing you to dive deep into infrastructure design, data infrastructure, automation, and cloud-native technologies.
 



 Enjoy a flexible hybrid work model, balancing time between client offices, your company's headquarters in Stockholm, and remote work. This varied approach allows you to immerse yourself in client environments, collaborate closely with your team, and maintain productivity from home when needed. You'll engage in projects of various scales, collaborating with cross-functional teams and interfacing directly with clients to deliver tailored solutions.
 



 You'll get a competitive salary offering up to 70,000 SEK per month (depending on your experience). The company is committed to professional growth, with plans to offer clear paths to leadership roles as the company expands. With ambitious growth plans, there's potential for advancement to senior technical positions in the future. On top of this, you’ll get 30 days vacation, a health and wellness allowance (friskvård), and private pension contributions.
 



  





**What you'd be doing?** 




 You'll typically work in agile teams of 5-6 people, sometimes scaling up for larger projects. You might spearhead new initiatives, assessing client needs and building your team from within the company.
 



 Your work will involve designing, implementing, and maintaining infrastructure for CI/CD, automating deployment processes, and managing Kubernetes clusters and related cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure. You’ll be responsible for optimising development pipelines, infrastructure, data, and QA processes, as well as implementing best practices around monitoring, tracing, metrics, and alerts.
 



 A key aspect of your role will be enhancing the developer experience within the team and solving customers' infrastructure-related problems. You’ll advocate for solutions and, when appropriate, push for the adoption of the company’s own tools and frameworks. Your consultant-style approach will see you acting as a partner and support outside the customer environment.
 



  





**About you?** 




 Deep experience working with Kubernetes, with a strong focus on automation and infrastructure optimisation. You thrive in environments that require independence in learning and working and enjoy close collaboration with cross-functional teams.
 



 You have experience configuring and managing cloud platforms like AWS and Azure, as well as on-premise solutions. An automation-first mindset is crucial, and experience with Python or similar languages is a bonus. Leadership experience and strong communication skills are highly valued, as you'll mentor team members and interface with clients while contributing to the evolution of DevOps practices within the team.
 



 Consultant-style experience is beneficial, as client interaction is a significant part of the role, and fluency in both Swedish and English is a must for effective client communication.
 



  





**A bit about them?** 




 A growing tech consultancy in Stockholm, specializing in software and infrastructure solutions for the energy sector. They partner with both established industry leaders and innovative startups, focusing on data-driven applications that promote sustainability.
 



 The company culture emphasizes collaboration, continuous learning, and making a positive impact in the green tech space. They're seeking motivated individuals who can drive technical discussions and align with their mission to create meaningful solutions in the energy sector.
 



 With a current team of about 45 and plans for significant growth, this role offers an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of energy tech innovation in a rapidly expanding organization.
 



  





*Don't worry if your CV isn't up to date - just send me a message on LinkedIn or an email over to mitch@zebrapeople.com and we can go from there.* 




  





*3 stage Interview Process* 




*Initial Chat, Technical Discussion, Final with CEO*

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
🚀
 **I’m Hiring in Sweden!** 
 🚀
 



 Are you a talented DevOps engineer ready to take on an exciting short-term consultancy assignment? We’re looking for someone with a passion for optimizing processes and enhancing collaboration across teams.
 



  





 If you're eager to make an impact and thrive in a dynamic environment, don’t wait—apply now! Let’s take your career to the next level together!
 



  






 🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a DevOps Engineer🚀
 




  






 Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our Devops Engineer.
 





 About VIPAS :
 




 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
 



  






 Job Description:
 




 We are seeking a 
 
 DevOps engineer
 
  for a short-term consultancy assignment.
 



 The primary responsibility is to lead the migration of data and repositories 
 
 from Azure and GitLab to GitHub
 
 . The ideal candidate will have proven experience with version control systems, cloud platforms, and data migration strategies. Familiarity with
 
  iOS DevOps processes
 
 , including continuous integration and delivery pipelines for mobile apps, is desirable and will be considered an advantage.
 



  






 Key Responsibilities:
 




 Lead the migration of repositories and data from Azure and GitLab to GitHub, ensuring data integrity and minimal downtime.
 



 Develop and implement migration strategies, workflows, and best practices.
 



 Collaborate with development teams to ensure seamless integration of the new version control system.
 



 Optimize existing CI/CD pipelines for mobile applications, particularly within iOS development environments.
 



 Provide documentation and training to the team on new processes and tools.
 



 Troubleshoot and resolve issues that arise during the migration process.
 



  






 Requirements:
 




 Proven experience as a DevOps Engineer or similar role, with a focus on version control systems and cloud platforms.
 



 Strong expertise in Git, Azure, GitLab, and GitHub.
 



 Experience with data migration strategies and tools.
 



 Familiarity with iOS DevOps processes, including continuous integration and delivery for mobile apps.
 



 Proficient in scripting and automation tools (e.g., Bash, Python, or similar).
 



 Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.
 



 Strong communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
 



 English only is sufficient language skill for this assignment.
 



  






 Why Join Us?
 




 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
 



  





 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
 



  





 Apply Now & 
 
 Please feel free to reach me at sandhya@vipas.se
 




 Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.
 



  






 How to Apply:
 




 Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!
 



 Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**Job Title:** 
 DevOps Engineer
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Type:** 
 Full-time
   

  

**About The Company**
 This dynamic consultancy, based in Stockholm, partners with a diverse range of clients to deliver cutting-edge DevOps solutions. The company specializes in optimizing cloud infrastructure, automating processes, and ensuring seamless delivery pipelines for organizations across various industries.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 The DevOps Engineer will collaborate with development teams to enhance infrastructure, automate deployment processes, and implement robust CI/CD pipelines. This role is crucial in ensuring the scalability, security, and efficiency of the clients’ operations.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design, implement, and manage CI/CD pipelines for various clients.
* Automate infrastructure provisioning and deployment using tools like Terraform, Ansible, or similar.
* Monitor and maintain cloud environments (AWS, Azure, or GCP) to ensure high availability and performance.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive DevOps best practices and continuous improvement.


**Qualifications**
* Proven experience in DevOps, with a focus on automation and cloud infrastructure.
* Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash).
* Experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and orchestration.
* Familiarity with configuration management tools (e.g., Ansible, Chef, Puppet).
* Strong problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset.


**Why Join Us?**
* Work on exciting projects with leading clients across multiple industries.
* Be part of a talented and innovative team in a vibrant Stockholm tech community.
* Competitive salary and benefits, with opportunities for professional growth.

title: DevOps Engineer / SRE
description:
***Fluent Speaking Swedish Candidates Only!***
 ocation: Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 Type: Full-Time, Permanent
   

  

 Salary: Up to 70,000 SEK (depending on experience)
   

  

**The Job**
 A top consultancy in Stockholm is looking for a DevOps/SRE Consultant. If you’re into automation, cloud, and making systems run smoothly, this could be a great fit.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Client Interaction: Work closely with clients to improve their infrastructure using DevOps/SRE best practices.
* Automation: Use tools like Terraform, Ansible, PowerShell, Bash, and Python to automate tasks.
* Cloud Work: Design and deploy solutions on Azure and Azure DevOps, plus manage containers with Docker and Kubernetes.
* System Reliability: Keep systems fast, secure, and available with tools like Datadog, Prometheus, CloudWatch, etc.
* CI/CD: Build and maintain efficient CI/CD pipelines.


**What You’ll Need**
* Fluent Swedish.
* 3-5 years in DevOps/SRE, preferably in a consultancy.
* Strong cloud, automation, and monitoring skills.
* Problem-solving mindset.
* Extra points for certifications (AWS, Google Cloud, etc.).


**Why You’ll Love It**
* Work on a variety of projects with top clients.
* Be part of an innovative, collaborative team.
* Competitive salary, great benefits, and life in vibrant Stockholm.
* Recognized as one of the best workplaces in Sweden and Europe!
