title: Senior Python Developer
description:
***Please, Swedish speaking candidates***
*ONLY.*
**Salary:** 
 70,000SEK
   

  

**Location:** 
 Hybrid/Stockholm
   

  

**About The Company**
 The company specializes in software development for energy companies and startups, focusing on product development, data engineering, and cloud infrastructure. The team leverages tools like Kubernetes, Airflow, and PostgreSQL, integrates machine learning with Spark and PyTorch, and develops UIs using React and ThreeJS.
   

  

**About The Candidate**
 The ideal candidate is a backend developer with a passion for coding and technology, proficient in Python, and familiar with front-end technologies. They excel at problem-solving, making pragmatic decisions, and collaborating with the team to deliver scalable and maintainable solutions.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 The candidate will focus on backend development, working on projects that may occasionally require front-end support. Key responsibilities include mentoring, planning and executing backend projects, conducting code reviews, and leading development teams.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* 5+ years of experience with Python
* Strong understanding of backend development principles
* Experience with AWS and/or Azure deployments
* Proficiency in Docker, Git, and performance optimisation
* Leadership experience and strong communication skills
* Ability to manage and optimize large-scale applications
* Experience with integrating external APIs

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
At Schibsted Media, our newsrooms have made significant progress in developing AI solutions to improve editorial workflows. To build on this success, we at SPP are establishing a new team dedicated to creating a robust foundation for scaling AI integrations in our tools, particularly our Create CMS.
   

  

**Who Are We in SPP?**
 Shared Products & Platforms (SPP) offers a powerful suite of tools for newsrooms and journalists within Schibsted Media and to external partners. SPP supports the entire editorial process with advanced tools, enhancing content distribution by leveraging new technologies. From planning and discovery to creation and personalised recommendations in text, video, and sound, SPP meets the needs of modern media operations.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a talented Full Stack Engineer with a strong AI focus to join our newly formed AI Team in SPP. This expert team will consist of two full stack engineers and one product manager. Your initial mission will be to design and implement a solid foundation to support the integration and scaling of AI-powered services to enhance the capabilities of one of our key products.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Develop and enhance editorial tools with new AI-powered features to support rapidly emerging business and project needs
* Collaborate with our newsrooms and internal product teams to understand their needs and integrate AI solutions effectively.
* Lead the extension initiative in the CMS, to assist newsrooms in achieving AI-related functionality, and promote the reusability of these solutions across different newsrooms where possible.
* Work closely with the central Schibsted Media teams responsible for Data & AI, ensuring alignment and the use of the best-suited central capabilities.
* Ensure application performance, uptime, and scalability, while maintaining high standards for code quality and application design.
* Work with agile development methodologies, adhering to best practices and pursuing continued learning opportunities.
* Participate in all aspects of agile software development, including design, implementation, and deployment.
* Integrate AI models into web applications, ensuring seamless operation and performance.
* Stay current with industry trends and advancements by reading articles, attending webinars, and experimenting with new tools and technologies.
* Experiment with new AI techniques and tools to enhance existing solutions.
* Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback.


**About You**
* Proven experience in full stack development, with a strong focus on AI technologies. In-depth knowledge of technologies such as React, JavaScript/TypeScript, and Node.js.
* Familiarity with code management tools such as Git.
* Solid understanding and experience with AI and machine learning concepts and frameworks.
* Understanding of NLP techniques and libraries (e.g., NLTK, spaCy, Hugging Face Transformers) if working with text data.
* Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure, particularly their AI and machine learning services.
* Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and MLOps practices for continuous integration, delivery, and deployment of AI models.
* Ability to work autonomously and bring new perspectives to the team.
* Excellent team player with strong communication skills.
* Full professional proficiency in English.


**How To Apply**
 If you’re excited about the potential of AI and eager to be a part of transforming our editorial products, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Release & Configuration Manager
description:
**Release & Configuration Manager till ICA Sverige**
 ICA Sverige har påbörjat ett stort projekt för att implementera Infor M3 för vår partihandelsverksamhet och letar efter en engagerad Release & Config Manager för arbete med Infor M3 Cloud och ICAs interna miljöer. Vi står inför en mycket spännande framtid med implementation av nya arbetssätt och systemstöd inom främst order management, inventory management, warehouse management och finance.
   

  

**Om jobbet som Release & Configuration Manager**
 Som Release/Configuration Manager (RM/CM) hos oss ansvarar du för att förvalta legacy-systemens konfigurationsversioner, data och integrationer till M3-miljöer inför och under varje release-testcykel (SIT, UAT). Inför varje testcykel kommer du att säkerställa planering, förvaltning och samordning av testprocessen, inklusive:
   

  

* Att alla testfall är definierade och har testats i testmiljö.
* All godkänd konfiguration är sammanställd.
* Planering inför SIT/UAT där miljöerna är ”up to date” konfigurationsmässigt och sammankopplade på rätt sätt.
* SIT- och UAT-processerna genomförs
* Hantera releasekalendern och säkerställa att alla team är medvetna om kommande releaser
* Identifiera och hantera risker som kan påverka releaseprocessen.
* Dokumentera och kommunicera releaseplaner och statusuppdateringar.
* Implementera och förbättra releaseprocesser och verktyg.


 Utöver det, kommer du att också övervaka samtliga M3-applikationsreleaser, som släpps månadsvis, samt vara ansvarig för planeringen och samordningen av tester som verifierar funktionaliteten inom verksamheten innan dessa släpps in i test och produktionsmiljö.
   

  

**Är du den vi söker?**
 För att trivas i rollen, ser vi gärna att du har jobbat med liknande arbetsuppgifter i mer än 3 år och att du har högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande utbildning med relevant inriktning.
   

  

 Du kommer också behöva ta med dig:
   

  

* Förståelse för molntjänster som AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud Platform.
* Kunskap om konfigurationshantering och infrastruktur.
* Erfarenhet av ITIL-baserat ärendehanteringssystem för projektspårning som Atlassian.
* Erfarenhet av versionshanteringssystem som Git, SVN eller Mercurial.


 Vi söker dig som är kommunikativ, kvalitetsmedveten och noggrann. Du är utåtriktad och har stor förmåga att skapa och bibehålla både interna och externa relationer. Flexibilitet och förmåga att hantera flera uppgifter samtidigt är av stor vikt. Rollen kräver att du kan kommunicera bra med olika intressenter. Du har förmåga att arbeta väl i team och bygga starka arbetsrelationer samtidigt som du är en god ledare av dig själv och andra.
   

  

 För att vara aktuell för denna roll behöver du tala och skriva både svenska och engelska obehindrat.
   

  

 Läs mer om livet på ICA här.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, senast 25 oktober, då urval sker löpande. För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta rekryterande chef Georgios Savvidis, 010 4220745.
   

  

 ICA ska spegla våra kunder och samhället, vi strävar därför efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund, kompetenser, kunskap och erfarenheter. Vi värnar om goda arbetsmiljöförhållanden med mål om helt rökfria arbetsplatser. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå tester, bakgrundskontroller och drogtestning innan anställning.
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på ICA.

title: Business-minded Enterprise Architect – Stockholm
description:
We are currently looking for senior, business-oriented Enterprise Architects for our team. You will work in challenging and meaningful projects, using your expertise to change the way our customers work.
   

  

**We are looking for additional senior Enterprise Architects in our Design & Strategy team – people who want to create an impact that lasts. People who can see things from different angles and with new eyes.**
**Are you a Senior business-minded Enterprise Architect? Are you interested in key business initiatives such as e.g. strategic advisory, facilitating innovation and enabling transformational change? Do you both have a strategic mindset as well as hands-on experience in business and digitalisation improvement projects? If so – then we absolutely need you to join our team!**
 As a Senior Enterprise Architect at Solita you aim to create impact. With Solita’s Design & Strategy team, you design new business changes and strategies in collaboration with our clients’ business stakeholders and other Solitans. You are in a key role defining the business and project goals together with our clients.
   

  

 We’re building a better future for us all
   

  

 Solita Design & Strategy is a multitalented community of more than 150 strategy consultants, designers, enterprise architects and business transformation makers, who are driven by human insights and behaviour. We work with both our Swedish and international clients in their spaces or our communal spaces in northern and central Europe. Together with the rest of Solita’s diverse data and technology experts, we show the direction in which services of the future are designed and built.
   

  

 Solita is a workplace where you will always find a more knowledgeable, multi-disciplinary peer to spar with. People join us to become a part of a diverse community of experienced professionals and continuous learners. And people stay for the same reason. At Solita, you will find an easy-going work culture where you can be yourself no matter who you are. We offer support for our people both in work and also when life happens.
   

  

 What you would get to dig in to
   

  

 Your projects will concentrate on areas such as e.g. structure business strategy, business development, articulate business outcomes, support investment decisions, enable business innovation engagements, design current and target architecture, design and develop strategic plans and/or roadmaps, information architecture, business and/or data solution design, increase the agility and flexibility through enterprise architecture design, design of new eco systems.
   

  

 In this position, you might have a few projects at hand simultaneously, depending on your skillset and wish. There will be a lot of variation, and you will get a unique chance to work with a very experienced and innovative team! Further on, you will also get to specialize in the area of consulting that motivates you the most.
   

  

 What we hope you have in your carry-on;
   

  

 – Relevant educational background
   

  

 – Interest in consultative client work and create impact that lasts
   

  

 – Excellent presentation, moderation and communication skills
   

  

 – Strong analytical thinking skills
   

  

 – Consultative sales experience
   

  

 – Enterprise architecture modeling experience
   

  

 – Fluent Swedish and English language skills (mandatory for this role)
   

  

 What we offer you;
   

  

 – The chance to grow professionally in an international atmosphere
   

  

 – Personal growth, teamwork and learning from real experts in the field
   

  

 – A great group of people to work with, both in the client projects but also for afterworks and lunch runs!
   

  

 – A company that actually cares about your well-being, your development and passions
   

  

 Interested?
   

  

 Are you ready to take the first step towards joining Solita? Solita is a fast-growing Nordic company that works with digital transformation, fueled by data and human expertise. We work with both big and small customers, and have offices in Sweden, Finland, Germany, Estonia, Belgium and Denmark.

title: GIS Developer
description:
**Job Description** 




 The interest in flight simulation is soaring, and so are we! Navigraph is currently looking for a GIS Developer to join our team in Gamla Stan, Stockholm. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who wants to work on aeronautical data in a team of passionate experts with a GIS data pipeline that delivers an updated worldwide coverage every 28 days! In addition to enroute charts, we also visualize weather systems, jet winds, the tropopause, and thousands of aircraft positions!
 



  





**About Navigraph** 




 Navigraph is a SaaS (Software-as-a-Service) company serving the international flight simulator community with charts, navigation data, flight planning services, and training material. Thousands of active subscribers worldwide use Navigraph services in desktop and console flight simulators such as Microsoft Flight Simulator, X-Plane, and Prepar3D every day. Navigraph’s 1.3 million registered users fly for entertainment, curiosity, and possibly with the dream of one day becoming a pilot. Many active pilots also use Navigraph services because of their love for aviation.
 



  





 Navigraph was founded in 2003 and is headquartered in Stockholm. The team consists of 35 individuals with varying backgrounds in software development, aviation, marketing, and content creation. About two-thirds live near the Stockholm office, whereas the rest are based in countries such as the US, Canada, Austria, Australia, New Zealand, Ukraine, and the Czech Republic. The office language is English. Because of the rapid technical development of flight simulators and growing interest in aviation Navigraph has experienced a formidable growth over the past few years. Navigraph is still run and managed by its founders Magnus Axholt (CEO) and Stephen O’Connell (CTO). A vibrant user community, a solid product road map, a great product market fit, a thriving business, active and passionate founders, friendly and knowledgable colleagues, and an exceptional company culture make Navigraph a great place to work.
 



 Tasks and Responsibilities
 



  





 As a GIS Developer at Navigraph you will join the App Development team responsible for our Navigraph Charts software. The team uses agile methods with daily standups, a Kanban board, backlog grooming, and regular retrospective meetings.
 



  





 Your responsibility will be to develop and maintain the GIS data pipeline generating aeronautical, topographical, and weather maps. The pipeline ingests several data sources and produces the data that populates the vector tiles in our Navigraph Charts software. The pipeline also outputs raster tiles, which are used directly in Microsoft Flight Simulator, and other datasets exposed via APIs to third-party developers.
 



  





 Our infrastructure is built around AWS, Linux/Unix, and Postgres/PostGIS. We hope you are comfortable with Bash, Python (Numpy, Rasterio, GDAL), and QGIS (pg\_raster). The ultimate product is exposed using Mapbox and Leaflet. A good command of Mapbox Style Specification is important for clear and good-looking charts.
 



  





 Aviation and computer graphics are at the core of Navigraph. The App Development team already has GIS experts, and you will have a great exchange of ideas while building the GIS data pipeline. Experience with FME (Feature Manipulation Engine) and/or ArcGIS can be a merit, but the ambition of the current Navigraph GIS data pipeline is to continue developing based on open-source resources.
 



  





 As a GIS Developer at Navigraph, you will be performing the following tasks:
 



  




* **Ingest and transform raster and vector data into PostGIS:** 
 For example, write a script that automatically fetches magnetic declination data and imports it into PostGIS.
* **Process raster information to vector data:** 
 For example, transform the rasterized magnetic declination data into iso lines on vector tiles.
* **Generate tiles for the map clients:** 
 Generate map tiles in slippy map format for web-based consumption.
* **Style vector data to good-looking maps:** 
 For example, generate style for wind visualization.



  





**Required Qualifications** 




  




* Fluent in written and spoken English
* At least three years of experience in a similar position
* Linux/Unix & Bash
* AWS Cloud Computing
* Postgres/PostGIS
* pg\_raster
* Geospatial SQL
* GDAL
* Python
* Numpy
* Rasterio
* QGIS or ArcGIS
* Mapbox Style Specification
* OSM (Open Street Map) associated tools



  





**Desired Qualifications** 




  




* Typescript and Node.js
* Digital Elevation Models (DEM)
* 3D Modeling
* Personal Qualities
* Friendly
* Communicative
* Attention to detail
* A passion for cartography (and aviation and/or flight simulation)
* Curious and eager to learn
* Ability to identify areas of improvement



  





**Benefits** 



* **Workplace Insurance:** 
 As a responsible employer, we ensure that you are fully protected at work and during your commute.
* **Pension:** 
 Together with Nordea we help you invest your pension to prepare for a nice retirement.
* **Remote Work:** 
 You are free to work at the office or from home, as you like.
* **Home Office:** 
 We provide you with an ergonomic workplace at home.
* **Health Insurance:** 
 Quick help, typically the next day, to avoid long waits at the doctor’s.
* **Paid Vacation:** 
 You will receive 30 days of paid vacation in advance. This is great if you are joining us right before the holidays.
* **Gym Card:** 
 5,000 SEK/year in health benefits to sponsor your gym or sports club membership.
* **Parental Leave Top-Up:** 
 To compensate for a lower salary while on parental leave.
* **Complimentary Refreshments:** 
 All the cold drinks and warm beverages you need to stay productive and inspired.
* **Free Training:** 
 We help you become an expert in your professional area.
* **Activities, Trips & Parties:** 
 We go on one or two conference trips yearly, host a Christmas party, and regularly arrange team activities.



  





**Application** 




 Please submit your application via the Navigraph Career website at careers.navigraph.com. The position is available immediately, and we are continuously reviewing applications and setting up interviews.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Senior Software Engineer**


We are looking for a talented Software Engineer to join our Engineering team!


Minna connects global banks and fintech with subscription businesses to give consumers self-serve subscription management in-app. Minna is a technology partner to top-tier financial institutions, fintech and subscription businesses, providing subscription management functionality for 50+ million banking and fintech customers across the United States, United Kingdom and Europe.


Minna builds the infrastructure that links Subscription Merchants (such as Netflix, Spotify, Amazon) to leading Financial Institutions (Lloyds Bank, ING Belgium, Swedbank to name a few). This connection enables consumers to effortlessly manage their subscriptions by performing actions like canceling, pausing, or changing their plans.


At Minna, Product and Engineering work closely together and our organization structure truly empowers our teams, allowing us to solve problems quickly and drive real results. We have a tight bond and collaborate daily on the most highly prioritized improvements.

**Responsibilities**

* Design, implement, test, deploy and maintain software as part of the defined Software Development Lifecycle.
* Contribute to defining the team's technical vision and the necessary steps to achieve it.
* Provide technical expertise in the discovery phase of Product Development.
* Ensure all solutions we create are compliant with any certifications, rules and regulations as well as not negatively impact our target service levels.
* Participate actively in the team’s rituals (can vary between teams).
* Software Engineers with Ops-access are part of our on-call process to ensure our systems are available around the clock.
* Collaborate with senior team members to design and drive the architecture of the platform

**Requirements**

* Strong proficiency in Java, with a minimum of 5+ years of hands-on experience developing backend applications.
* Scala and Kotlin experience beneficial
* Experience in designing and building RESTful APIs, and distributed systems.
* Proficient in working with databases, including familiarity with NoSQL databases.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to quickly understand complex systems and identify effective solutions.
* Quality focused mindset, bringing excellence and continuous improvement to our products.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment.
* Prior experience in Agile development methodologies and practices.
* Demonstrated ability to quickly learn new technologies and programming languages as needed.
  

**Our global benefits**

* Freedom to choose your way of working, you get the opportunity to choose from where and when you work
* Private health insurance
* Subscription allowance


Find more information about our benefits here


Minna is an equal opportunities employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, nationality, ethnicity, skin colour, religion, disability or sexual orientation. We celebrate and embrace a diverse workforce and are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills.

title: Camera Systems Development Engineer
description:
**Techster Solutions** befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst **1+** års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

  

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

 **Assignment Description**


Our client in the automotive industry is currently seeking a talented and driven Camera Systems Development Engineer (Focus Area: Verification) to join their Exterior Vision team, specializing in camera systems.


In this role, you will play a crucial part in system design, ensuring that stakeholder and internal requirements are met to support the camera perception stack. You will also be instrumental in verifying and enhancing the capabilities of their exterior camera data providers at component, system, and vehicle levels.

**Main Responsibilities:**

* **Product Verification**: Conduct comprehensive verification of the exterior camera data provider’s capabilities at various levels, including component, system, and in-vehicle.
* **Test Management & Maintenance**: Develop, implement, and maintain testing procedures to ensure the highest quality and performance of their camera systems.
* **Requirements Understanding**: Gather and analyze stakeholder and internal requirements for the camera platform, ensuring they are effectively integrated into the perception stack.
* **System Development Insight**: Maintain a comprehensive understanding of the entire system development process, ensuring coherence across different components and systems. Document and report product status.

**Required Qualifications:**

* **Proactive and Driven**: Possess a highly engaged and proactive personality, capable of taking charge of projects and driving them to successful completion.
* **Collaboration**: Enjoy collaborating with diverse teams and stakeholders to achieve common goals.
* **Lifelong Learner**: Demonstrate a commitment to lifelong learning and continuously seek ways to improve work efficiency. Team members are expected to:
	+ Help each other proactively.
	+ Step outside specific role-related tasks when needed.
	+ Prioritize actions that contribute to the team’s success, including coaching, supporting, and sharing development information and tasks.
* **Educational Background**: A degree is not mandatory if you can demonstrate a driven personality and technical competency.
* **Interdisciplinary Interest**: Enthusiastic about working in a dynamic, interdisciplinary technology field, integrating knowledge from various domains.
* **Driving License**: Hold a European B driving license.

**Additional Qualifications:**

* Experience in the automotive industry.
* System Designing Tools: Familiarity with tools like Carweaver, DOORS, etc.
* Verification Tools: Experience with DSA, DLT, Prompt Command, Git, WinSCP, etc.
* Network Protocols: Understanding of Ethernet, TCP/IP, CAN.
* Operating Systems: Proficiency in Linux.
* Automotive Diagnostic Concepts.
* Version Control and CI Tools: Experience with Git, Gerrit, Jenkins.
* NVIDIA Automotive Hardware/Software Tools.


Note: Not all of the additional qualifications are prerequisites. However, a willingness to learn and grow in these areas is essential.


**Ansökan**  

Tror du att du är **Techster Solutions** nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.


Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Test Engineer, HIL and CI
description:
**Techster Solutions** befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst **5+** års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

  

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

  

**Assignemnt Description**


Our automotive industry client is in search of a Test Engineer with expertise in HIL and Continuous Integration (CI).

**Main Responsibilities:**


As a Test Engineer specializing in HIL, your role will involve the following tasks:

* **HIL Rig Design and Maintenance:** You will be responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) test rigs. This includes ensuring that they are continuously updated and able to simulate the necessary operational conditions effectively.
* **Test Case Development and Automation:** You will create and automate test cases across various environments, such as HIL, Model-in-the-Loop (MIL), and laboratory settings, ensuring the accuracy and consistency of test results.
* **Support for System Testing:** You will assist in testing the full system within vehicles, ensuring all integrated components perform correctly and meet the required performance benchmarks.
* **Beta Testing and Feedback Management:** You will manage beta testing activities and create a feedback loop based on data to assess system performance. This involves working with dashboards and metrics to facilitate efficient data collection and reporting.
* **Enhancing Testing Efficiency:** You will ensure the optimal use of testing setups to fully assess developed functionalities, with a focus on evaluating battery cell performance in areas like range, charging, and energy efficiency, all while maintaining safety and system dependability.

**Required Qualifications:**

* At least 5 years of experience in electrical engineering and software development within the automotive sector.
* A minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience with battery-related software.
* A degree in electrical engineering or a related discipline.
* Strong programming skills in Matlab/Simulink, Python, and Azure.
* Proficiency in HIL development, particularly with tools like ETAS, Vector, NI, and Speedgoat, both in hardware and software.

**Desired Attributes:**

* High initiative, effective collaboration skills, and a strong ability to work across teams.

**Ansökan**  

Tror du att du är **Techster Solutions** nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.


Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: R&D Mechanical Engineer
description:
**R&D Mechanical Engineer**
===========================

#### **At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. That's our story. Make it your story.**

### **Your role and responsibilities**


ABB Smart Power is a global technology leader, with products and solutions that make power supplies smart, connected and protected. Its intelligent products and solutions make power more competitive by improving Sustainability, energy efficiency, productivity, and reliability of almost any operation. You will be reporting to the R&D Electromechanical Chapter Leader and joining the Load Control Agile Unit based in Västerås, Sweden. This unit operates within ABB Electrification/Smart Power division, dedicated for developing and taking care of our portfolio within low voltage products such as contactors and soft starters. You will be part of one of our multifunctional Agile Team and be fully accountable of the activity assigned to you, you will have the possibility to interact with the product owner and support in the definition of the global product strategy. •Together with the other designers you will work in develop new solution and enhance the actual product platform focusing on DC contactors application and on the renewable energy market requirement. •You will experience and contribute to different phase of the project, from the idea to production, interacting with local and global stakeholders. •You be part of the Electromechanical Design Chapter and contribute to the technical growth of all the team, sharing best practice and lessons learned. •Furthermore, you will have great opportunities to grow professionally, both in the location and within our global company.

### **Qualifications for the role**

* Bachelors´ or Masters’ Degree in Mechanic, Mechatronic Engineering or equivalent.
* Basic knowledge of CAD software (CREO is a plus).
* 2 or more years of experience in similar design role.
* Knowledge of different material technology (Metal, plastic, ...).
* Knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodology is a plus.
* Fluent in Swedish and English written and spoken.
* Ability to prioritize, structure and drive your work by yourself.
* Furthermore, you are a relationship-building and responsive team player who is good at communicating.

### **More about us**


Recruiting Manager David Karlén, +46 (0)70 380 70 11. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Senad Huijc, +46 730 88 30 06; Ledarna: Lenny Larsson, +46 706 32 85 47, Unionen: Johan Lundström, +46 730 77 03 66. Talent Partner: Ludvig Ahlqvist. We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply latest 14th of October. Visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory
company_description: ABB is a leading global technology company that energizes the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

title: Automation Engineer
description:
The European Spallation Source ERIC (ESS) is a partnership organisation of 13 European member countries located in the city of Lund, Sweden. The ESS is one of the largest science and technology infrastructure projects being built today. The project includes the most powerful linear proton accelerator ever built, a five-tonne, helium-cooled tungsten target wheel, 15 state-of-the-art neutron instruments, a suite of laboratories, and a supercomputing data management and software development centre. In the context of its history and future as a scientific organisation, however, it is more than the sum of its parts. It is a brand new Big Science organisation and we are building it from the ground up.


*Come and build the future of Science with us!*


**About the role**



The ESS is at an exciting turning point - it is in transition from being a construction site, to being an operating facility. To help us realise our goal of being the most powerful neutron source in the world, we are now seeking to appoint an Automation Engineer for the Motion Control & Automation Group (MCAG). The MCAG is responsible for deploying PLC motion control systems to the Neutron Scattering Instruments, delivered by European in-kind partners to ESS. The task of the group is to develop standards for motion at ESS and work with partners to implement these across the whole facility. The focus of the group is to support the construction of neutron instruments in NSS.



The position requires an expert in Motion Control and PLC systems especially for the design, procurement, installation and commissioning of motion control related components and control systems.



Your main areas of responsibilities as an Automation Engineer will be to:


* Support the Lead Instrument Engineer in calculating, selecting and procuring motion control components for instrument systems adhering to ESS standards.
* Plan and perform the motion control related parts of the different Acceptance Tests (FAT, SAT) at the suppliers, in-kind partners and ESS.
* Prepare design input documentation for cabinet and cable installations on the basis of instrument requirements and ESS generic designs; interface to the MCAG ePlan team for electrical drawings and other design documentation.
* Supervise and support the installation of instrument systems on ESS site and the energisation process; program and commission the systems.
* Compile and provide the Instrument Teams with the relevant documentation necessary to pass the different ESS reviews from design to commissioning.
* Communicate and link between the different Instruments Teams, suppliers, MCAG and other ESS groups relevant for motion control.


This is a 3-year fixed-term position, with the possibility of future opportunities in the organisation. It is based in Lund, Sweden, and we need someone who can start as soon as practically possible.


**About you**



To thrive in this role, we believe that you have a university degree (MSc, BSc) in Electrical or Mechatronic Engineering with a strong focus on Motion Control and Automation. You have experience in design, program, test and commissioning of electrical control systems in industrial or scientific environment. Experience in managing small development projects and interfacing with scientists and scientific project managers is important.



Furthermore, you have:


* Experience in preparing documentation according to the engineering workflow of a control system construction project.
* Experience in reading and reviewing electrical drawings, preferably in ePlan.
* Fluency in written and spoken English.

Additional experiences that will be an advantage for the appointed candidate include:


* Experience in the design and programming of PLCs and motion control systems preferably for scientific large-scale user facilities; knowledge of Beckhoff TwinCAT.
* Knowledge of scientific instruments and its associated motion control and automation techniques, as well as a good knowledge of motion control components and its use in radiation environment.


We believe that you enjoy communication and collaborating with a large number of internal and external stakeholders, and you feel comfortable working in an international environment. You should be self-motivated, and be used to make decisions and deliver according to deadlines and milestones. Writing and documenting comes naturally to you, and you have confidence in organising and running efficient and successful meetings.


**What can we offer?**



Aside from the chance to work at a truly unique Big Science project, you can also expect:


* An opportunity to contribute to the future discoveries within neutron science.
* A stunning, brand new workplace filled with innovative minds and brilliant people from across the globe.
* A challenging, innovative and stimulating work environment.
* 30 days of annual leave, as well as more than 10 days of public holiday and company days off or days with limited working hours.
* Monthly pension contributions on top of your salary.
* Focus on work-life balance.
* Preventative healthcare benefit.
* Where applicable, relocation support and allowances may also be available.

**Interested? We sure hope so.**



If you see yourself in what we’re looking for, please provide your CV and motivation letter in English . Please be aware that we can only accept direct applications made via the ESS website. We will review applications continuously so please apply as soon as you can, or by 23 October, 2024 at the latest.



Certain roles at ESS require health and safety and/or security checks, which may be carried out during the recruitment process.



For more information regarding the ESS recruitment process, please see https://europeanspallationsource.se/careers or contact Recruitment Officer Åsa Ander at asa.ander@ess.eu



For further information regarding the position, please contact the hiring manager Thomas Gahl at thomas.gahl@ess.eu



For trade union information, please contact Unionen representative Mikael Johansson at mikael.johansson@ess.eu or SACO/Swedish Association of Graduate Engineers representative Marc Kickulies at marc.kickulies@ess.eu


*We look forward to receiving your application!*

title: Senior Design Engineer
description:
Job Description:
**Embedded Software Developer**

**What we are looking for**  

We are seeking a passionate and skilled **Embedded Software Developer** to join our embedded team **in Lund**. You should be familiar with the entire process, from hardware prototypes and production tests to developing a full application platform on multiple targets. In this role, you will collaborate closely with the local hardware team and global application teams to integrate new products into our Building Management System (BMS).
Our team has designed an RTOS platform used internally and as a foundation for other teams globally within Schneider. The primary goal is to build a wide range of sensors and gateways based on STM32 and EFR32 processors. Experience in this area opens opportunities to work with both types of product ranges. **You will be responsible** for driving all aspects of embedded platform development, from the initial bring-up of hardware prototypes to the final product release. This includes managing the integration of software and hardware components, troubleshooting issues, and optimizing performance. You will coordinate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless collaboration and timely delivery of milestones, ensuring that the embedded platform is fully operational and meets quality standards by the time of the final release.

 **Responsibilities**

* **Collaborate effectively:** Work closely with both local and global teams.
* **Ensure best practices:** Follow and promote best practices in a dynamic and iterative Agile development setting.
* **Evolve the platform:** You will have significant freedom to innovate and improve the platform.
* **Consult as an embedded expert:** Provide expertise internally and to our partners.

 **Required skills and experiences**

* **Embedded software development**: At least 3 years of experience
* **Hardware design understanding**: Good knowledge of hardware designs
* **Debugging and optimization:** Strong experience in debugging, profiling, and optimizing code
* **C development:** Proficiency in C programming
* **Educational background**: Bachelor’s degree or higher in software engineering
* **Communication skills**: Good verbal and written English and Swedish communication skills

 **Desired skills and experiences**

* **Communication Protocols**: Knowledge of protocols like I2C, SPI, UART, and Ethernet
* **Debugging Tools:** Familiarity with JTAG, SWD, logic analyzers, and oscilloscopes
* **Cybersecurity:** Understanding of security principles and practices for embedded systems
* **Problem-Solving:** Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
* **Documentation:** Ability to create clear and concise technical documentation

 **What do we offer you?**


This is a great opportunity to join Schneider Electric and power your career! You will be joining an international, dynamic, and responsible company, with an enviable reputation in the market. Schneider fosters the development of all its’ people around the world. Every day, we empower employees to achieve more and experience exciting careers. Find out how our values and unique position make Schneider Electric the employer of choice – apply now. **About our Team:**
Building Management System (BMS) team is a cross-functional squad working together to drive and develop sophisticated digital building management solutions within the Buildings – Technical Department at Schneider Electric, based in Lund.

  

We develop the full system solution, from IOT sensors and controllers to final presentation in the web interface.


Whilst we are extremely proud of what we have built so far, we are always looking for improvements, tech and process alike, and in true agile fashion prioritize learning above all else. The BMS team fosters a culture of collaboration, trust, and encouragement.

  

We are embracing the hybrid way of working and like to work from the office 3 days a week, empowering you to take full advantage of flexibility and tailor your work week.

 **What we do:**
We develop digitalized solutions to building management which ultimately minimizes climate impact, saves money, and time. Our state-of-the-art BMS platform provides foundational technology to enable the digitization of a range of solutions that allows customers manage Buildings in a better way.

  

The BMS platform is one of the pillars of Schneider Electric’s EcoStruxure offering.


When you work for Schneider Electric you work for a company focused on its people. We are proud to promote diversity, inclusion, people development and work-life integration!

  



Qualifications:
**Let us learn about you! Apply today.** **You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.**
About Our Company: **Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?**


When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our IMPACT values – Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork – starts with us.


IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.


We are looking for IMPACT Makers; exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.


Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric – apply today!


€36 billion global revenue  

+13% organic growth  

150 000+ employees in 100+ countries  

#1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations

  

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled. *Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and ‘inclusion’ is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do. This extends to our Candidates and is embedded in our Hiring Practices.*  

  

*You can find out more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion* *here**and our DEI Policy* *here* *At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. You can find out more about our Trust Charter* *here*  

  

*Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.*

title: Hardware Engineer - Planboo
description:
Hi! We’re excited you’re here :)


This opening is for our partner, Planboo.


We help organizations around the world build teams for a sustainable future. Together we are on a mission to leverage technology to regenerate our planet and advance human potential.


Planboo is committed to revolutionizing carbon removal through innovative biochar solutions. Working with climate-conscious businesses, farmers, land stewards, and biochar producers, Planboo provides the tools, technology, and training needed to transform sustainably sourced biomass into biochar, generating carbon removal credits and enhancing soil health. Their mission is to permanently remove CO₂ from the atmosphere, supporting people and food systems to prosper.

**The Challenge**


Are you a passionate about scaling hardware to solve complex technical challenges while making a positive impact on the planet? As a Hardware Engineer, you will play a critical role in leading the development of Planboo’s IoT Greenbox solution. Planboo’s methodology combines hardware and software IoT technology. With this they can digitally Measure, Report and Verify (MRV) carbon removal in real-time from anywhere by automatising data gathering from the biochar production.


Your challenge: Improve the technical capabilities of IoT Greenbox taking it from a Raspberry Pi (prototype) to a scalable hardware system that can survive in challenging conditions.


**Key Responsibilities**

* **Product Development:** Strong programming background with a holistic view of building hardware systems and firmware.
* **Design Thinking**: Translating learnings and protocols from R&D to a scaleable hardware system.
* **Continuous Innovation:** Managing devices deployed in the field (maintenance, updates, functionality, deployment logistics).
* **Strategy Focus**: Formalising processes within the department, strategy and milestone setting, protocols.
* **Stakeholder Collaboration**: Work closely with the founders and other departments to align hardware solutions with Planboo’s business goals.
* **Documentation**: Record comprehensive system protocols for continuous testing and iteration.
* **Agile Mindset:** Ability to try new things and adapt to changing requirements.

**Requirements**

**What We’re Looking For**

* A degree in Electrical Engineering and a minimum of 3 years related experience.
* Strong IoT development skills and firmware programming.
* Experience in component sourcing, logistics, fabrication and supply chain management.
* An understanding of data processing and analytics.
* Strong focus on project management, ability to own goals and manage progress.
* Oversight and understanding of logistics and procurement.
* Excellent problem-solving skills, with experience integrating software with hardware products.
* Bonus Points: Experience with carbon removal projects, embedded systems, or working in international, mission-driven teams.

**Who You Are**

* You are an ambitious builder who thrives in a fast-paced, startup environment.
* You’re a team player who enjoys mentoring others and solving challenges collaboratively.
* You’re passionate about making a positive impact on the planet through your technical skills.
* You are adaptable, pragmatic, and committed to delivering reliable, scalable software.

**Benefits**

**What We Offer You**

* An opportunity to make a measurable, positive impact on global carbon removal efforts.
* The chance to work directly with Planboo’s leadership team and contribute to high-level strategic decision-making.
* A flexible, mission-driven work environment with room for personal and professional growth.
* Travel opportunities to project locations, including spending time in **Sri Lanka** for several weeks.

**Who We Are**


Join a diverse team of engineers, farmers, scientists, and visionaries tackling global challenges. We believe in Win-Win collaboration, Relentlessness, and Authenticity. Planboo is committed to advancing CO2 removal, addressing global inequality, and fostering a workplace where diversity of thought is celebrated.


Planboo is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer, and we encourage applicants of all backgrounds to apply.

title: IXL Application Design Engineer
description:
Req ID:460081


At Alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Every day, 80,000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars.

  



Could you be the full-time **IXL Application Design Engineer** in **Stockholm, Sweden** we’re looking for?

  


**Your future role**


Take on a new challenge and apply your expertise in a new cutting-edge field. You’ll report to (Trackside Engineering Manager based in Stockholm) and work alongside passionate, motivated and dedicated teammates.

  


You'll be responsible for the software configuration of Interlocking (IXL). The signalling system consists of Mechanical, Electromechanical, Electric, Electronic and Software components that together ensure safe movements of trains. The purpose of the job is to take part to the execution of IXL application design activities of a Signaling project, adopt the Alstom application design process and ensure the delivery accordingly to the projects schedule and quality commitments.

  


The IXL Application Design Engineer shares with Project IXL design leader the progress of the activities executed, the issues and the potential improvement that can be applied on methods and tools.

  


**We’ll look to you for:**


* Delivering design scheme plan layouts, Control Tables, signaling logic application data, diagnostic application data using our internal configuration tools.
* Ensuring the application and adherence to the reference application design methods & tools, requesting in cooperation with the Project IXL design leader deviations whenever appropriate
* Participating actively in the IXL detailed design review meetings and providing activity progress reports
* Organizing and producing documentation and software design deliveries according to the project planning
* Actively supporting the Project IXL design leader and Project V&V manager in design issues debugging
* Analyzing and managing change requests. Contributing to the definition of the software package deliverables to the Verification & Validation team. Managing the hand over to the Installation, Testing & Commissioning team
* Ensuring independent workflow between the application design and the verification activities

  




**All about you**


We value passion and attitude over experience. That’s why we don’t expect you to have every single skill. Instead, we’ve listed some that we think will help you succeed and grow in this role:


* Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree (preferably in Transport or equivalent)
* 1 year in IXL and/or TMS and/or ERTMS application design or 1 year experience in relevant positions (systems / sub-system application design) in a highly complex and normative environment (railway signaling, aerospace, defense).
* Foreign language: English
* Understanding of the railway traffic control system
* Adaptability, flexibility and effective time management
* A proactive and resourceful approach
* Sense of urgency

  




**Things you’ll enjoy**


Join us on a life-long transformative journey – the rail industry is here to stay, so you can grow and develop new skills and experiences throughout your career. You’ll also:


* Enjoy stability, challenges and a long-term career free from boring daily routines
* Work with new security standards for rail signalling
* Collaborate with transverse teams and helpful colleagues to accelerate your personal growth
* Contribute to innovative projects
* Utilise our hybrid working environment
* Steer your career in whatever direction you choose across functions and countries
* Benefit from our investment in your development, through award-winning learning
* Progress towards to senior positions
* Benefit from a fair and dynamic reward package that recognises your performance and potential, plus comprehensive and competitive social coverage (life, medical, sports card)

  




You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. If you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!

  


**Important to note**


As a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 63 countries we operate in. We’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.

  


  

**Job Segment:** Testing, Developer, Technology
company_description: Leading societies to a low carbon future, Alstom develops and markets mobility solutions that provide the sustainable foundations for the future of transportation.

title: System Test Engineer - HIL
description:
Are you passionate about cutting-edge technology and eager to shape the future of system testing? We’re looking for a driven and innovative System Test Engineer – HIL to join our team. In this role, you’ll be instrumental in developing world-class automated test methods, collaborating with colleagues from around the globe in a dynamic and diverse work environment.  


**Join our team**
At Epiroc, we believe in the power of collaboration, where different perspectives come together to achieve great things. We foster a culture of learning and innovation—where it’s okay to make decisions and even make mistakes, because that’s how we grow. We believe work should be fun, inspiring, and a place where creativity thrives.  


Located in Örebro, near the city center, our modern workspace and nearby nature provide a perfect balance between work and relaxation. We also have office and workshop facilities in Kvarntorp, where our test track and test mine are located, 20 km south of Örebro.  


**Your mission**As a System Test Engineer, you will:  


* Develop and refine automated test methods for HIL environments, utilizing Python/Pytest, NI Veristand, and Vector CANalyzer.
* Analyze and review requirement specifications to ensure alignment with test strategies.
* Document test plans and outcomes through detailed test specifications and reports.
* Continuously improve test methods, focusing on test automation and efficiency.
* Gain a deep understanding of plant models that simulate mechanical, drivetrain, hydraulic, and electrical systems.

  


**Your profile**To thrive in this role, you are self-driven, proactive, and able to plan your work effectively to meet deadlines. You approach challenges holistically, balancing the big picture with an ability to dive into technical details when needed. Strong communication and interpersonal skills are key, as you’ll collaborate closely with teams across different functions and regions, ensuring clear and effective communication with all stakeholders.  


At Epiroc, we value diversity and see differences in background, experience, and perspective as strengths that lead to innovation and long-term success.  


**Qualifications:**  


* A degree in Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field (B.Sc. or M.Sc.).
* At least 2 years of experience in test automation.
* Familiarity with communication interfaces such as CAN Open, CAN J1939 for real-time systems.
* Proficiency in Python programming.
* Experience with Vector CANalyzer and/or NI Veristand.
* Previous involvement in product development, verification, and validation.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* As a global organization English is our corporate language and is widely used, both in spoken and written form. Knowledge of Swedish is beneficial but not mandatory.

  


**Location and travel**
This position is located Örebro, Sweden. Occasional travel is required.  


**Life at Epiroc**
By joining our team, you can expect an atmosphere of creativity, innovation, and workplace diversity. You will be a part of a group of skilled and helpful colleagues who live by our core values: Collaboration, Commitment, and Innovation. We work in a global environment with over 113 different nationalities! In addition to the fact that we have a culture that is characterized by development combined with having a good balance between work and leisure, there are some things that makes us a little extra proud to work at Epiroc:  


* Global career opportunities
* Epiroc University, for your own competence development
* Community involvement
* Benefits package, which amongst other things include flexible working hours and bonus.

  


**Application and contact information**  


Please send your application, including CV and personal letter, by creating an account in our recruitment system as soon as possible but no later than 2024-10-13. We review applications on a rolling basis. Please note that due to regulations, we cannot handle applications received through email.  


For questions about the position please contact hiring manager: Jonathan Paul Roth, Manager System Verification & Validation, johnathan.toth@epiroc.com.  

For questions about the recruitment process or application please contact: Nesrin.kaddoura@epiroc.com  

We have already made our choices regarding advertising channels and consulting providers, and kindly request not to be contacted regarding such inquiries.  



**Epiroc** is a global productivity partner for mining and construction customers, and accelerates the transformation toward a sustainable society. With ground-breaking technology, Epiroc develops and provides innovative and safe equipment, such as drill rigs, rock excavation and construction equipment and tools for surface and underground applications. The company also offers world-class service and other aftermarket support as well as solutions for automation, digitalization and electrification. Epiroc is based in Stockholm, Sweden, had revenues of more than SEK 60 billion in 2023, and has around 18 200 passionate employees supporting and collaborating with customers in around 150 countries. Learn more at www.epirocgroup.com.

title: Camera Systems Development Engineer
description:
Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst 1+ års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
  
Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
  
Assignment Description
  
Our client in the automotive industry is currently seeking a talented and driven Camera Systems Development Engineer (Focus Area: Verification) to join their Exterior Vision team, specializing in camera systems.
  
In this role, you will play a crucial part in system design, ensuring that stakeholder and internal requirements are met to support the camera perception stack. You will also be instrumental in verifying and enhancing the capabilities of their exterior camera data providers at component, system, and vehicle levels.
  
  

**Main Responsibilities:**  

**Product Verification:** Conduct comprehensive verification of the exterior camera data provider’s capabilities at various levels, including component, system, and in-vehicle.
  
**Test Management & Maintenance:** Develop, implement, and maintain testing procedures to ensure the highest quality and performance of their camera systems.
  
**Requirements Understanding:** Gather and analyze stakeholder and internal requirements for the camera platform, ensuring they are effectively integrated into the perception stack.
  
**System Development Insight:** Maintain a comprehensive understanding of the entire system development process, ensuring coherence across different components and systems. Document and report product status.
  
  

**Required Qualifications:**  

**Proactive and Driven:** Possess a highly engaged and proactive personality, capable of taking charge of projects and driving them to successful completion.
  
**Collaboration:** Enjoy collaborating with diverse teams and stakeholders to achieve common goals.
  
**Lifelong Learner:** Demonstrate a commitment to lifelong learning and continuously seek ways to improve work efficiency. Team members are expected to: Help each other proactively.
  
Step outside specific role-related tasks when needed.
  
Prioritize actions that contribute to the team’s success, including coaching, supporting, and sharing development information and tasks.
  
  

**Educational Background:** A degree is not mandatory if you can demonstrate a driven personality and technical competency.
  
**Interdisciplinary Interest:** Enthusiastic about working in a dynamic, interdisciplinary technology field, integrating knowledge from various domains.
  
**Driving License:** Hold a European B driving license.
  
  

**Additional Qualifications:**  

Experience in the automotive industry.
  
**System Designing Tools:** Familiarity with tools like Carweaver, DOORS, etc.
  
**Verification Tools:** Experience with DSA, DLT, Prompt Command, Git, WinSCP, etc.
  
**Network Protocols:** Understanding of Ethernet, TCP/IP, CAN.
  
**Operating Systems:** Proficiency in Linux.
  
Automotive Diagnostic Concepts.
  
**Version Control and CI Tools:** Experience with Git, Gerrit, Jenkins.
  
NVIDIA Automotive Hardware/Software Tools.

title: Test Engineer, HIL and CI
description:
Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst 5+ års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
  
Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
  
Assignemnt Description
  
Our automotive industry client is in search of a Test Engineer with expertise in HIL and Continuous Integration (CI).
  
  

**Main Responsibilities:**  

As a Test Engineer specializing in HIL, your role will involve the following tasks:
  
**HIL Rig Design and Maintenance:** You will be responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) test rigs. This includes ensuring that they are continuously updated and able to simulate the necessary operational conditions effectively.
  
**Test Case Development and Automation:** You will create and automate test cases across various environments, such as HIL, Model-in-the-Loop (MIL), and laboratory settings, ensuring the accuracy and consistency of test results.
  
**Support for System Testing:** You will assist in testing the full system within vehicles, ensuring all integrated components perform correctly and meet the required performance benchmarks.
  
**Beta Testing and Feedback Management:** You will manage beta testing activities and create a feedback loop based on data to assess system performance. This involves working with dashboards and metrics to facilitate efficient data collection and reporting.
  
**Enhancing Testing Efficiency:** You will ensure the optimal use of testing setups to fully assess developed functionalities, with a focus on evaluating battery cell performance in areas like range, charging, and energy efficiency, all while maintaining safety and system dependability.
  
  

**Required Qualifications:**  

At least 5 years of experience in electrical engineering and software development within the automotive sector.
  
A minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience with battery-related software.
  
A degree in electrical engineering or a related discipline.
  
Strong programming skills in Matlab/Simulink, Python, and Azure.
  
Proficiency in HIL development, particularly with tools like ETAS, Vector, NI, and Speedgoat, both in hardware and software.
  
  

**Desired Attributes:**  

High initiative, effective collaboration skills, and a strong ability to work across teams.

title: Software test engineer
description:
Job description
  
  

The System Test Engineer and Integration Engineer will work with test and verification of automotive applications. The role of the System Test and Integration Engineer is to ensure that our products are compliant to applicable requirements and to assure delivery of safe, reliable and stable products to our customers. System Tests, System Integration, Test Planning, Field support, verification and fault-analysis of our products is within the work scope.
  
  

**In your role you will:**  

* Prepare Test Plans to verify and ensure that system meets its design specifications and requirements within the project.
* Write Test Specification, Test Environment Specification, Test Record, Test Reports within a project
* Develop and execute test cases and related scripts for scenario-based testing in lab environment.
* Analysis of test results, reporting deviations from expected system behavior
* Support lab configuration setup according to technical specifications
* Plan, coordinate and support of System Integration activities
* Support Project Management, Project Engineering and System Engineering
* Re-create, analyze and suggest potential solutions of reported error reports
* Participate in field and integration tests if required
* Participate and support in system integrations in vehicles if required
* Communicate within the organization and customers
* •Participates in technical document reviews and prepare documents for submission to the customers and suppliers;
* Document results of executed test cases
* Be responsible for documents such as Test Specification, Test Environment Specification and Test Record


Your profile
  
* Bachelor of Engineering degree or equivalent work experience in development projects


Technical experience within system integration and testing in development projects.
  
* Knowledge of DOORS is a merit
* English and Swedish business fluent are highly valued for this role

title: Konsultchef inom Mjukvaru- och Systemutveckling
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Söker du en arbetsplats där du dagligen får utmanas och utvecklas inom entreprenörskap, ledarskap och ingenjörskap? Då är Sigma Industry Development rätt företag för dig.



Sigma Industry Development är ett dotterbolag inom SIEN-koncernen som fortsätter sin framgångsrika tillväxtresa utan att tumma på kvalitet. Två år i följd har pris vunnits som ett av Sveriges bäst välskötta företag, samt topp10-ranking i medarbetartrivsel på nationell nivå. Med andra ord är manegen krattad för fortsatta framgångar och arbetsglädje.



Nu söker vi en konsultchef till sektionen Mekatronik. Sektionen utgörs idag av 13 ingenjörer inom AI, mjukvaru- och hårdvaruutveckling, test och verifiering. Du kommer ha fördelen att ansluta dig till en etablerad kundbas, men ha fria tyglar att sätta din prägel på verksamheten och dess framtida strategi, samtidigt som teamet vill utvecklas genom ditt ledarskap och målsättningar.


### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**



Din uppgift är att hjälpa teamet och verksamheten att utvecklas ytterligare, genom att navigera mot hög tillväxt och säkerställa nya affärer. Din roll är mångfacetterad där du kommer arbetar med att anställa de bästa talangerna och utveckla dessa, samtidigt som du brinner för affärsutveckling där målet är att etablera nya kundsamarbeten och driver in de stora affärerna. Detta utan att varken köra slut på ditt bränsle eller skada den goda (arbets-) miljön.



Vi ser att du har erfarenhet från försäljning och ledarskap i konsultbranschen, samt ett brett nätverk i Stockholmsregionen och du är en person som inte bara snackar utan gillar att få saker att hända.



**Utbildning**



* MSc i Datavetenskap, Mekatronik, Teknisk fysik, eller liknande utbildningsbakgrund


**Erfarenhet inom**



* Ledarskap
* Försäljning
* Konsulttjänster


**Språkkunskap**



* Svenska och engelska, flytande i tal och skrift (båda är krav för anställning)

### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**



Om AI har en speciell plats i ditt ingenjörshjärta, betraktar vi detta som en extra fördel. Vi som företag är måna om att hålla jämna takt med omvärlden och vi har som strategi att kontinuerligt fördjupa oss i de fördelar artificiell intelligens för med sig, i syfte att öka produktivitet - för oss och våra kunder.


### **WE OFFER**



Sigma Industry Development erbjuder dig en plattform att forma din framtid. Ett företag där du kan briljera och bidra till det bättre.



**Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) – ett urval**



https://starforlife.org/



https://expectabettertomorrow.com/



https://www.parasport.se/



https://rfkhumanrights.org/leadership-council



**Våra Kärnvärden**



* Familjär identitet - vi värnar om och utmanar varandra i det dagliga arbetet
* Långsiktighet - vi vill växa tillsammans med individen på kort och lång sikt
* Jämställdhet och lika behandling - kom som du är!
* Kreativitet & action - vi är beslutsamma och agerar i sann entreprenörsanda; framåt
* Arbetsglädje - vi gillar att ha kul tillsammans!


**Till detta tillkommer följande förmåner**



* Mobiltelefon och abonnemang
* Liv- och olycksförsäkring
* Friskvårdsbidrag om 5000 SEK/år
* 30 dagar semester

### **MORE INFORMATION**



Om du vill vidareutvecklas i rollen som Konsultchef – ta dig mod och skicka in din ansökan till oss idag! Skriv även några rader med dina tankar om tjänsten. Intervjuer sker löpande så vänta inte.



Om du har frågor är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Oscar för frågor och mer info.



Oscar Silversparf, VD, Sigma Industry Development



+46 70 209 22 26



oscar.silversparf@sigma.se

Konsultchef inom Mjukvaru- och Systemutveckling

Sigma Industry Development

Stockholm, Sweden

Mechanical Engineering, Hardware Electronics, Testing and Verification, Project Management, Software development embedded systems, Function development, System design, Project Management, Software development

2024-09-16

2024-10-31

Oscar Silversparf, oscar.silversparf@sigma.se, +46702092226
